deceasedcraft.tip.parkour: TqLxQuanZ: Did you know you can perform parkour? Be sure to check out the ParCool book guide for tips and techniques.
deceasedcraft.tip.advance_equipments: TqLxQuanZ: Many advanced materials require machines from Immersive Engineering or Create to manufacture, so be sure to familiarize yourself with them.
deceasedcraft.tip.heavy_machines: TqLxQuanZ: Many of Immersive Engineering's multiblock machines can be found in buildings in the wasteland.
deceasedcraft.tip.nature_compass: TqLxQuanZ: Unable to find the biome you need? Give Nature's Compass a try!
deceasedcraft.tip.weapons: TqLxQuanZ: Weapons have varying attack ranges, speeds, and patterns.
deceasedcraft.tip.building_loots: TqLxQuanZ: Each type of building contains unique loot specific to its category. Loot restaurants for food, hospitals for medical supplies, or police stations for guns!
deceasedcraft.tip.bullets: TqLxQuanZ: You can acquire bullets or ammunition from special buildings or purchase from specific NPC.
deceasedcraft.tip.c70: _C70_: Converting an existing building into your base is a recommended strategy, as it can provide shelter and security while saving resources.
deceasedcraft.tip.hazmat: TqLxQuanZ: The Hazmat suit offers immunity to infection, making them a crucial protective garment against zombies.
deceasedcraft.tip.straighten_car: CaptainSparklez: You can press space bar while driving to straighten your car. Helps a lot when navigating the subways.
deceasedcraft.tip.quest_book: Mygnol: Remember, you can always consult the Quest Book if you're lost at any time by pressing F7.

quest.intro.hotkeys.subtitle: The numbers... what do they mean?!
quest.intro.hotkeys.description_1: Below is a list of hotkeys you might find useful while playing.

quest.guide.world.foodhealth.title: More Food, More Health
quest.guide.world.foodhealth.subtitle: Stress eating.
quest.guide.world.foodhealth.description: The more types of food you consume, the more ¬ßbbonus hearts¬ßr you get.
This guidebook serves as a tracker for the foods you have eaten.
¬ßcWARNING:¬ßr It is recommended you try to focus on increasing your max HP only once you're confident you can survive, as these bonuses can only be claimed once!
quest.guide.parkour.title: Beginner's Guide to Parkour
quest.guide.parkour.subtitle: This book... it's written in parkour...
quest.guide.parkour.description_1: Many of the important skills are listed in the images below. For a more comprehensive guide, make sure to read through the ¬ßbParcool¬ßr guidebook!
quest.guide.parkour.description_2: Learning to use parkour properly will give you an advantage when navigating in the city - consider building a parkour course to familiarize yourself.
quest.guide.parkour.description_3: If you want to ¬ßcdisable¬ßr certain Parcool actions, press ¬ß6[Alt+P]¬ßr to bring up the config menu.
quest.guide.parkour.crawl: You can crawl by holding ¬ßbC¬ßr; it allows you to go through 1-block-height spots.
quest.guide.parkour.ziplinehook.title: Ziplines
quest.guide.parkour.ziplinehook.subtitle: Hang in there...
quest.guide.parkour.ziplinehook.descript: Parcool introduces ¬ßbziplines¬ßr, which allow you to travel between buildings that are connected by zipline hooks.
To begin, craft a wooden or iron zipline hook.
quest.guide.parkour.ziplinerope.title: Zipline Rope
quest.guide.parkour.ziplinerope.subtitle: Bridging the Gap
quest.guide.parkour.ziplinerope.descript: Once your hooks are installed, you can connect them with zipline rope. ¬ß6[Shift-Right Click]¬ßr to adjust the tension on the rope.
You can grab onto zipline ropes by jumping and holding right click.
quest.guide.parkour.dodge: You can dodge by tapping CTRL while moving!
quest.guide.parkour.wall_slide: You can hold right click when falling next to a wall to go down slowly!
quest.guide.parkour.cling: You can hold right click near a block border to cling on the wall.
quest.guide.parkour.cat_leap: Tap shift while running to cat leap!
quest.guide.parkour.slide: Hold C while running to slide.
quest.guide.parkour.breakfall: Press R before landing for minimal damage!
quest.guide.survival.subtitle: AKA: How to not die instantly.
quest.guide.survival.thirst.title: Dealing With Thirst
quest.guide.survival.thirst.subtitle: Be like water.
quest.guide.survival.thirst.description_: Bottled water is ¬ßcdirty¬ßr by default, and must be purified by boiling in order to safely be drunk.
quest.guide.survival.furnace.title: Let Him Cook - I
quest.guide.survival.furnace.subtitle: The normal way.
quest.guide.survival.furnace.description: Boil water in a ¬ßbfurnace¬ßr to purify it, ensuring it is safe for consumption.
quest.guide.survival.cooking_pot.title: Let Him Cook - II
quest.guide.survival.cooking_pot.desc_1: Boil a water bucket in a ¬ßbcooking pot¬ßr to get 16 purified water, which you can take out with a glass bottle. Remember to retrieve your bucket!
quest.guide.survival.sink.title: Water on Demand
quest.guide.survival.sink.subtitle: Let that Sink In
quest.guide.survival.sink.description_1: Some sinks can provide an endless supply of water, but keep in mind it still needs to be boiled!
quest.guide.survival.water.title: Purified Water
quest.guide.survival.water.subtitle: Crystal clear.
quest.guide.survival.water.description_1: Once purified, water can be safely consumed.
quest.guide.survival.fiber.title: Fiber on Demand
quest.guide.survival.fiber.subtitle: Hemp 101
quest.guide.survival.fiber.description_1: Collect ¬ßbhemp seeds¬ßr from grass and plant them to start growing hemp plants. It's recommended you keep a healthy amount of these, as crafting string uses a lot of fibre.
quest.guide.survival.string.title: String
quest.guide.survival.string.description_: Craft hemp into string, or loot it from cities.
quest.guide.survival.wool.title: Wool
quest.guide.survival.wool.description_1: Craft string into wool. Or start a sheep farm.
quest.guide.survival.herbs.title: Healing Herbs
quest.guide.survival.herbs.subtitle: It's the green, it's the green, it's the green you need...
quest.guide.survival.herbs.description_1: Healing herbs are essential for crafting higher tier recovery items. Unfortunately, they can only be looted from ¬ßbmedical buildings¬ßr.
quest.guide.survival.tonic.title: Tonic
quest.guide.survival.plaster.title: I need healing.
quest.guide.survival.plaster.subtitle: For the small ouchies.
quest.guide.survival.plaster.description: Plasters don't heal much, but they are cheap to craft.
quest.guide.survival.bandages.title: I need healing!
quest.guide.survival.bandages.subtitle: For larger wounds.
quest.guide.survival.bandages.descriptio: While better than bandages, consider saving up to craft these into ¬ßbmedkits¬ßr instead, which are much more powerful.
quest.guide.survival.medkit.title: I NEED HEALING!!
quest.guide.survival.medkit.subtitle: ...I guess we're sewing your arm back on.
quest.guide.survival.medkit.description_: The best tier of medical treatment. You could craft these... but perhaps it would be better to try and find them in ¬ßbhospitals¬ßr.
quest.guide.survival.headache.title: Headache
quest.guide.survival.headache.subtitle: Caused by damage to your head.
quest.guide.survival.vulnerability.title: Vulnerability
quest.guide.survival.vulnerability.subti: Caused by damage to your torso.
quest.guide.survival.vulnerability.descr: All damage taken from any source except falling is ¬ßcincreased¬ßr by 20%% per level.
quest.guide.survival.mining_fatigue.subt: Caused by damage to your arms.
quest.guide.survival.weakness.title: Weakness
quest.guide.survival.weakness.subtitle: Caused by damage to your arms.
quest.guide.survival.weakness.descriptio: ¬ßcWeakens¬ßr your attack damage, possibly reducing it to 0 if it's already low enough.
quest.guide.survival.hard_falling.title: Hard Falling
quest.guide.survival.hard_falling.subtit: Caused by damage to your legs.
quest.guide.survival.hard_falling.descri: Fall damage is ¬ßcincreased¬ßr by 20%% per level.
quest.guide.survival.slowness.title: Slowness
quest.guide.survival.slowness.subtitle: Caused by damage to your feet.
quest.guide.survival.life.title: LIFE
quest.guide.survival.life.subtitle: Welcome to the world.
quest.guide.survival.life.description_1: Managing your health is essential to survival. This modpack has ¬ß6body part damage¬ßr, which means limbs can be damaged, causing debuffs.
quest.guide.survival.life.description_2: You can check the status of your limbs at any time by pressing ¬ß6[H]¬ßr to bring up the health tab.
quest.guide.survival.life.description_3: A list of debuffs caused by damage to each limb is provided below.
quest.guide.survival.death.title: DEATH
quest.guide.survival.death.subtitle: Ask not for whom the bell tolls...
quest.guide.survival.death.description_1: Death means ¬ßcpermanently¬ßr losing 1 heart gained from Crystal Hearts, so try avoiding it as much as possible!
quest.guide.survival.death.description_2: The minimum amount of hearts you can have is ¬ß610¬ßr. If you are still learning, it may be wise to wait till you are better prepared before trying to gain extra hearts.
quest.guide.survival.death.description_3: ¬ß6Vanilla hearts are separate from body part damage.¬ßr You can lose all your limbs and you will not die besides suffering the debuffs, but losing all your vanilla hearts will kill you!
quest.guide.survival.death.description_4: Keeping your vanilla hearts at full health will regenerate your limbs over time, but slowly. Regeneration potions will also heal your limbs over time as well.
quest.guide.survival.hearts.title: Crystal Hearts
quest.guide.survival.hearts.subtitle: Me and my broken heart...
quest.guide.survival.hearts.description_: Crystal Hearts can be looted from ¬ßbhospital buildings¬ßr. Each one increases your max health by ¬ßbone heart¬ßr, up to a total of 10 hearts.
¬ßcWARNING:¬ßr It is recommended you try to focus on increasing your max HP only once you're confident you can survive, as these items cannot be crafted!
quest.guide.temperature.subtitle: Ahhhh, that's hot.
quest.guide.temperature.boiler.title: Warm Me Up
quest.guide.temperature.boiler.subtitle: Getting hot in here...
quest.guide.temperature.boiler.descripti: Boilers provide heat in a radius if powered by redstone and provided with ¬ßbburnable materials¬ßr like coal.
quest.guide.temperature.icebox.title: Cool Me Down
quest.guide.temperature.icebox.subtitle: Chill out, bro...
quest.guide.temperature.icebox.descripti: Iceboxes provide chill in an area if  powered by redstone and provided with ¬ßbfrozen items¬ßr like ice.
quest.guide.temperature.thermometer.desc: A thermometer can accurately measure the present temperature of the environment.
Craft or find one from ¬ßbresidential houses¬ßr.
quest.guide.temperature.seasons.title: Seasons
quest.guide.temperature.seasons.subtitle: Let it snow
quest.guide.temperature.seasons.descript: The ambient ¬ßbtemperature¬ßr of a region changes depending on the ¬ßrseason¬ßr, with ¬ß6summer¬ßr and ¬ßbwinter¬ßr being the ¬ß6hottest¬ßr and ¬ßbcoldest¬ßr respectively.
Putting a ¬ßbcalendar¬ßr in an ¬ßbitem frame¬ßr will allow you to keep track of the ¬ßbcurrent season¬ßr, as well as how many ¬ß6days¬ßr are left till the ¬ßbnext season¬ßr.
Craft or find one from ¬ßbresidential houses¬ßr.
quest.guide.temperature.insulation.title: Insulating Armor
quest.guide.temperature.insulation.descr: A grace period of ¬ßb5 minutes¬ßr is given on every respawn during which you are immune to changes in temperature.
However, venturing further into the city will require insulating your armor, and you will quickly freeze or overheat if unprepared.
Use a ¬ßbsewing table¬ßr to insulate your armor with various materials.
quest.guide.temperature.cold_1.title: Beating the Heat - I
quest.guide.temperature.cold_1.descripti: Coat your armor to increase ¬ß6heat resistance¬ßr by 3 points.
quest.guide.temperature.cold_2.title: Beating the Heat - II
quest.guide.temperature.cold_2.descripti: Coat your armor to increase ¬ß6heat resistance¬ßr by 5 points.
quest.guide.temperature.cold_3.title: Beating the Heat - III
quest.guide.temperature.cold_3.descripti: Coat your armor to increase ¬ß6heat resistance¬ßr by 7 points.
quest.guide.temperature.hot_1.title: Bracing the Cold - I
quest.guide.temperature.hot_1.descriptio: Coat your armor to increase ¬ßbcold resistance¬ßr by 3 points.
quest.guide.temperature.hot_2.title: Bracing the Cold - II
quest.guide.temperature.hot_2.descriptio: Coat your armor to increase ¬ßbcold resistance¬ßr by 5 points.
quest.guide.temperature.hot_3.title: Bracing the Cold - III
quest.guide.temperature.hot_3.descriptio: Coat your armor to increase ¬ßbcold resistance¬ßr by 7 points.
quest.guide.temperature.adapt_1.title: Adaptive Insulation - I
quest.guide.temperature.adapt_1.descript: Coat your armor to increase ¬ßdboth resistances¬ßr by 3 points.
quest.guide.temperature.adapt_2.title: Adaptive Insulation - II
quest.guide.temperature.adapt_2.descript: Coat your armor to increase ¬ßdboth resistances¬ßr by 5 points.
quest.guide.temperature.adapt_3.title: Adaptive Insulation - III
quest.guide.temperature.adapt_3.descript: Coat your armor to increase ¬ßdboth resistances¬ßr by 7 points.
quest.guide.hordebuilding.subtitle: DONT DEAD OPEN INSIDE
quest.guide.hordebuilding.title: Not your regular building...
quest.guide.hordebuilding.desc_1: Certain ¬ßbspecial buildings¬ßr will always contain a ¬ßchorde¬ßr of infected.
quest.guide.hordebuilding.desc_1.horde: You have entered a horde building!
quest.guide.hordebuilding.desc_2: Clear the horde by killing the infected.
quest.guide.hordebuilding.desc_2.horde: The horde seems to be lessening...
quest.guide.hordebuilding.desc_3: Once the horde has been dealt with, the building can be explored normally.
quest.guide.hordewave.subtitle: 15 days to Die
quest.guide.hordewave.title: The zombies... they're coming...
quest.guide.hordewave.desc_1: Infected hordes show up every ¬ßc15¬ßr days. This counter is tracked ¬ß6per player¬ßr, and not tied to overall server time. ¬ßcIf you are in multiplayer, this could mean hordes back to back!¬ßr
quest.guide.hordewave.desc_2: Each subsequent horde will be ¬ßcstronger¬ßr than the last, so be sure to upgrade your gear and prepare defenses for your base!
quest.guide.hordewave.desc_3: Crafting a ¬ßbhorde calendar¬ßr and right clicking it will show you how many days are left until the next horde.
quest.guide.scrapping.title: Recycling Items
quest.guide.scrapping.subtitle: *Anvil Break Noises*
quest.guide.scrapping.subtitle_2: You've got the scraps... now to find a cave.
quest.guide.scrapping.desc_1: Items with the ¬ß6"Scrappable"¬ßr tooltip can be recycled at a ¬ßbscrapping table¬ßr.
quest.guide.scrapping.desc_2: Scrapped items will return ¬ß630%%~70%%¬ßr of the items used to craft them.
quest.guide.scrapping.desc_3: To scrap an item, place a scrappable item on the table with ¬ß6[F]¬ßr, then ¬ß6left click¬ßr your scrapping hammer while looking at the item.
quest.guide.tutorial.subtitle: Welcome to DeceasedCraft!
quest.guide.tutorial.readme.title: Welcome to DeceasedCraft!
quest.guide.tutorial.readme.subtitle: This is how you died...
quest.guide.tutorial.readme.description_:
If you've just started a new world, you will have ¬ßbone day¬ßr of relative safety where no zombies will spawn. 
Use it to familiarize yourself with the guidebook!

¬ßcWARNING:¬ßr While world generation will try to place you in the ¬ßbSuburb Residential District¬ßr, ¬ßcthe district may still be too small to successfully survive in¬ßr.

If that is the case, you may want to consider re-generating a new world.
quest.guide.tutorial.intro.title: The First Days
quest.guide.tutorial.intro.subtitle: After the Apocalypse
quest.guide.tutorial.intro.description_1:
This questline provides a ¬ßbrough guide¬ßr to help you progress from the beginning of the game to a comfortable midgame.
It will make references to many of the ¬ß6Guides¬ßr in the section below ‚Äî  take some time to check them out!

----------

¬ß7Many thought it would take longer for society to collapse. That they would have months to prepare, or at least a few weeks to find shelter.¬ßr
quest.guide.tutorial.intro.description_2: ¬ß7Instead, it happened almost overnight. People turned on the streets, in their homes, in their shelters ‚Äî  seemingly at random for no reason at all.¬ßr
quest.guide.tutorial.intro.description_3:
¬ß7Those that did not soon found themselves wishing they had.¬ßr

¬ßoPerhaps your fate will be different?¬ßr
quest.guide.tutorial.infection.title: Unavoidable Infection
quest.guide.tutorial.infection.subtitle: One bite is all it takes‚Ä¶ well, maybe a couple.
quest.guide.tutorial.infection.descripti: All zombies have a chance to ¬ßcinfect¬ßr their victims upon making contact during an attack.
The infection progresses slowly through multiple stages. Letting it take over will result in your character becoming a zombie.
Certain armor types can negate this effect.
quest.guide.tutorial.goldenapple.title: ¬ßaLoot¬ßr - Golden Apples
quest.guide.tutorial.goldenapple.subtitl: An apple a day keeps the zombies away.
quest.guide.tutorial.goldenapple.descrip: The only cure for the infection is by eating ¬ßbgolden apples¬ßr.
As they cannot be crafted you will have to loot them from ¬ßbmedical buildings¬ßr.
In your starting district, this is the ¬ßbPolyclinic¬ßr ‚Äî but beware, it is heavily guarded by the dead.
quest.guide.world.specialization.title: Talents and Specialization
quest.guide.world.specialization.descrip: Pressing ¬ß6[F10]¬ßr will open up your skill tree, which can provide useful perks to improve your performance.
Skills can be levelled up by doing their respective actions, or by reading special guide books found as loot.
quest.guide.world.nether.title: The Nether and the End
quest.guide.world.nether.subtitle: Just a figment of your imagination...
quest.guide.world.nether.description_1: The Nether and the End do ¬ßcnot¬ßr exist in this modpack. Instead, you will have to loot their resources from the city.
quest.guide.world.compass.title: ¬ß9Craft¬ßr - Nature's Compass
quest.guide.world.compass.subtitle: Guide to Nowhere
quest.guide.world.compass.description_1: A ¬ßbNature's Compass¬ßr is invaluable for finding biomes such as the ¬ßbvolcano¬ßr and ¬ßbwasteland¬ßr, as well for locating ¬ßbdistricts¬ßr.
quest.guide.world.compass.description_2:
¬ß6Useful biomes to search for:¬ßr

¬ßbSnowy Plains¬ßr = ¬ßeRetail District¬ßr
¬ßbConiferous Forest¬ßr = ¬ßeHighrise Residential District¬ßr
¬ßbPlain¬ßr = ¬ßeHighrise Office District¬ßr
¬ßbRainforest¬ßr = ¬ßeHighrise Hotel District¬ßr
quest.guide.world.compass.description_3: ¬ßcNOTE:¬ßr The compass will always guide you to the closest biome of that type within ¬ß65000¬ßr blocks, so travel in the opposite direction if the biome you find doesn't end up suitable for you!
quest.guide.tutorial.districts.title: Suburb Residential - ¬ßeTier 1 District¬ßr
quest.guide.tutorial.districts.subtitle: What do you mean people live in these?
quest.guide.tutorial.districts.descripti: This modpack is split into ¬ß66¬ßr districts, each with increasing ¬ßcdifficulty¬ßr and ¬ßctemperature¬ßr.
You should always spawn in the ¬ßbSuburban Residential¬ßr district, which is relatively peaceful.

¬ßcIt is recommended to only explore other districts once you've prepared sufficiently.¬ßr 
The following quests list some recommended items you should try to get in each tier of district before you move on.
For a detailed list of all districts and their buildings, consult the ¬ß6District List¬ßr chapter.
quest.guide.world.backpack.title: ¬ß9Craft¬ßr - Backpack
quest.guide.world.backpack.subtitle: Everything including the kitchen sink.
quest.guide.world.backpack.description_1: As you scavenge, you are likely to run out of space for items extremely quickly.
quest.guide.world.backpack.description_2: Consider crafting a ¬ßbbackpack¬ßr and upgrading it as soon as possible.
quest.guide.world.backpack.description_3: ¬ßcNOTE:¬ßr You are limited to only having ¬ßbone¬ßr backpack at a time. Carrying more backpacks in your inventory will ¬ßcslow you down¬ßr!
quest.guide.tutorial.canteen.title: ¬ß9Craft¬ßr|¬ßaLoot¬ßr - Canteen
quest.guide.tutorial.canteen.subtitle: Compact water source
quest.guide.tutorial.canteen.description: ¬ßbCanteens¬ßr are useful for storing large amounts of water to drink when you get thirsty.
An added benefit is that water stored in it will be ¬ßbautomatically purified¬ßr. However, there are more efficient ways of restoring thirst.
For further information on obtaining and purifying water, do check out the ¬ß6Survival¬ßr chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.healing.title: ¬ß9Craft¬ßr | ¬ßaLoot¬ßr - Healing Items
quest.guide.tutorial.healing.subtitle: Patch yourself up
quest.guide.tutorial.healing.description: Looted ¬ßbstring¬ßr and ¬ßbwool¬ßr can be crafted into ¬ßbbandages¬ßr, which provide a small amount of healing.
You should aim to have a healthy supply of these, as they are the main way of restoring health.
For further information on the body part health system in this mod, do check out the ¬ß6Survival¬ßr chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.supplies.title: ¬ßaLoot¬ßr - Supplies and Weapons
quest.guide.tutorial.supplies.subtitle: Can't fight on an empty stomach
quest.guide.tutorial.supplies.descriptio: Many early game ¬ßbweapons¬ßr and ¬ßbarmor¬ßr can be found by looting the starting district's houses and ¬ßbPolice Substation¬ßr.
Likewise, food can also be found by looting ¬ßbgas stations¬ßr.
If you have the resources, consider ¬ßbpreparing your food¬ßr instead of eating it raw, as cooked meals restore more hunger.
quest.guide.tutorial.insulation.title: Dealing with Temperature
quest.guide.tutorial.insulation.subtitle: Put on a Coat
quest.guide.tutorial.insulation.descript: ¬ßbCold String¬ßr and ¬ßbWarm String¬ßr can be used to craft ¬ßdCoats¬ßr, which when combined with armor on a ¬ßbsewing table¬ßr will allow you to venture further.
quest.guide.tutorial.tier_2_districts.de: Obtaining a full set of ¬ßdinsulated¬ßb armor will allow you to safely enter the ¬ßeTier 2¬ßr ¬ßbHighrise Office¬ßr ¬ß7(hot)¬ßr or ¬ßbHighrise Residential¬ßr ¬ß7(cold)¬ßr districts.
Consider ¬ßbupgrading your weapons¬ßr, as infected here will be ¬ßrstronger¬ßr than in the starter district.
For a detailed list of all districts and their buildings, consult the ¬ß6District List¬ßr chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.iron.title: ¬ßaLoot¬ßr - Iron
quest.guide.tutorial.iron.subtitle: The Iron Age
quest.guide.tutorial.iron.description_1: ¬ßeTier 2¬ßr districts contain iron, which can be used to craft the second tier of weapons and armor.
quest.guide.tutorial.iron.description_2: All ¬ßeTier 2¬ßr armor sets can be found in the ¬ß6Armor Sets¬ßr chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.iron.description_3: All ¬ßeTier 2¬ßr weapons can be found in the ¬ß6Melee Weapons¬ßr chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.guns.title: ¬ß9Craft¬ßr | ¬ßaLoot¬ßr - Ranged Weapons
quest.guide.tutorial.guns.subtitle: Pew! Pew! Pew!
quest.guide.tutorial.guns.description_1: ¬ßeTier 2¬ßr districts are the first place where you can reliably find ¬ßbguns¬ßr, their ¬ßbcomponents¬ßr and ¬ßbammunition¬ßr.
quest.guide.tutorial.guns.description_2: For a list of what components can be found in which district, consult the ¬ß6Ranged Weapons¬ßr chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.storage.title: ¬ß6Tech¬ßr | ¬ßaLoot¬ßr - Refined Storage
quest.guide.tutorial.storage.subtitle: It's not a hoarding problem, I swear
quest.guide.tutorial.storage.description: ¬ßbOffice buildings¬ßr in ¬ßeTier 2¬ßr districts contain an abundance of ¬ß6Refined Storage¬ßr loot.
This allows you to easily set up a ¬ßbRefined Storage system¬ßr, for easier management of all your items.
A basic guide to Refined Storage can be found in the ¬ß6Refined Storage¬ßr chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.power.title: ¬ß6Tech¬ßr | ¬ßaLoot¬ßr - Power
quest.guide.tutorial.power.subtitle: Keeping the lights on
quest.guide.tutorial.power.description_1: Many components needed to set up both ¬ß6Create¬ßr and ¬ß6Immersive Engineering¬ßr's power generation can be looted in the city.
quest.guide.tutorial.power.description_2: For now, the simplest power sources would be ¬ßbWater Wheels¬ßr for ¬ß6Create¬ßr, and ¬ßbThermoelectric Generators¬ßr for ¬ß6Immersive Engineering¬ßr.
quest.guide.tutorial.power.description_3: A list of all available power generation methods, and how to set them up can be found in the ¬ß6Power Generation¬ßr chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.steel_early.title: ¬ß6Tech¬ßr - Early Steel
quest.guide.tutorial.steel_early.descrip: ¬ß6Immersive Engineering¬ßr allows for the production of ¬ßbsteel¬ßr from ¬ßbiron¬ßr, a ¬ßeTier 3¬ßr material.
If you have an established base, setting up ¬ßbsteel production¬ßr will make exploring further much easier.
The steps to produce steel can be found in ¬ß6The Basics¬ßr and ¬ß6Advanced Materials¬ßr chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.basic_armor.title: ¬ßaLoot¬ßr - Basic Armor Components
quest.guide.tutorial.basic_armor.descrip: ¬ßbBasic Armor Components¬ßr are required to make and repair ¬ßbiron¬ßr gear.
It is recommended you save armor components for repairs, as iron gear can be easily looted in the city.
All ¬ßeTier 2¬ßr armor sets can be found in the ¬ß6Armor Sets¬ßr chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.base.title: Settling Down
quest.guide.tutorial.base.subtitle: A place to call Home
quest.guide.tutorial.base.description_1: If you haven't already, consider locating a suitable place to establish a permanent ¬ßbbase¬ßr, as further progression will require some ¬ß6tech¬ßr involvement.
quest.guide.tutorial.base.description_2: You can find specific buildings to live in using the ¬ßbBuilding Radar¬ßr.
quest.guide.tutorial.base.description_3: A guide on how to use it can be found in the ¬ß6District List¬ßr chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.npcs.title: ¬ßaLoot¬ßr - NPCs
quest.guide.tutorial.npcs.subtitle: You can take them home
quest.guide.tutorial.npcs.description_1: Finding and completing ¬ßbNPC quests¬ßr will allow you to ¬ßbtrade¬ßr with them, allowing for a renewable source of some important resources.
quest.guide.tutorial.npcs.description_2: You can pick them up and move them around by ¬ß6sneak-right clicking them with an empty hand¬ßr.
quest.guide.tutorial.npcs.description_3: A list of all NPCs and which district they can be found is in the ¬ß6District List¬ßr chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.tier_3_districts.de: Rare or better ¬ßdCoats¬ßr will allow you to safely enter the ¬ßeTier 3¬ßr ¬ßbHighrise Hotel¬ßr ¬ß7(very hot)¬ßr or ¬ßbRetail¬ßr ¬ß7(very cold)¬ßr districts.
Consider ¬ßbupgrading your weapons and armor¬ßr to at least ¬ßbiron¬ßr, or ¬ßbsteel¬ßr if you have it.
For a detailed list of all districts and their buildings, consult the ¬ß6District List¬ßr chapter.
¬ßbIntermediate Armor Components¬ßr are required to make and repair ¬ßbsteel¬ßr gear.
Steel gear is quite ¬ßcrare¬ßr, and it is likely you will need to ¬ßbmanually craft¬ßr a set.
All ¬ßeTier 3¬ßr armor sets can be found in the ¬ß6Armor Sets¬ßr chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.steel.title: ¬ßaLoot¬ßr - Steel
quest.guide.tutorial.steel.subtitle: The Steel Age
quest.guide.tutorial.steel.description_1: If you did not automate it, ¬ßbsteel¬ßr can be looted in ¬ßeTier 3¬ßr districts.
quest.guide.tutorial.steel.description_3: The steps to produce steel can be found in ¬ß6The Basics¬ßr and ¬ß6Advanced Materials¬ßr chapter.
quest.guide.tutorial.vehicles.title: ¬ß6Tech¬ßr | ¬ß9Craft¬ßr - Vehicles
quest.guide.tutorial.vehicles.subtitle: Are we there yet
quest.guide.tutorial.vehicles.descriptio: It is likely some districts will be located ¬ßca considerable distance away¬ßr from your starting location.
Consider making a ¬ßbcar¬ßr, ¬ßbtrain¬ßr or ¬ßbplane¬ßr to shorten the travel time!
Chapters on how to make vehicles can be found in the ¬ß6Transportation¬ßr tab.
quest.guide.world.animal_pen.title: ¬ß9Craft¬ßr - Animal Pens
quest.guide.world.animal_pen.subtitle: How do they all fit in there?
quest.guide.world.animal_pen.description: You can craft ¬ßbanimal pens¬ßr to compact large herds of animals into a single block.
Not only is this better for performance, it also allows for easier interaction and harvesting.
quest.guide.tutorial.wasteland.title: The Wasteland - ¬ßeTier 4 District¬ßr
quest.guide.tutorial.wasteland.subtitle: The Final Frontier
quest.guide.tutorial.wasteland.descripti: ¬ßcEND OF CONTENT: The beta does not contain content beyond this point!¬ßr
If you have reached this far, ¬ßbcongratulations¬ßr! You should be able to comfortably handle whatever this modpack throws at you.
From now on, ¬ßeyou will be on your own¬ßr ‚Äî bring your best ¬ßbgear¬ßr and ¬ßbweapons¬ßr, don as much ¬ßdheat protection¬ßr as you can, and get ready to face the start of the end.
quest.guide.tutorial.seek_cure.title: Rediscovering the Cure
quest.guide.tutorial.seek_cure.subtitle: A New Chapter Begins
quest.guide.tutorial.seek_cure.descripti: You may have learned to survive, but rebuilding civilization will take more than just skill and perseverance.
To truly escape the infection, you must learn to conquer it, a process which starts by rediscovering the methods used to craft the cure.
quest.main.cure.beginning.title: Seeking the Cure
quest.main.cure.beginning.subtitle: There has to be more, right?
quest.main.cure.beginning.description_1:
The cure seemingly only ¬ßotreats¬ßr the infection. It does nothing to prevent it. 
What remains in the ruined hospitals and polyclinics dwindles day by day. 
Without a means to make more, eventually, some day, it will run out.
quest.main.cure.beginning.description_2: And if it does, the last hope of restoring civilization dies with it.
quest.main.cure.beginning.description_3:
Perhaps you've learned of this truth through hard-fought survival.
Perhaps you simply wish to change the course of fate.
quest.main.cure.beginning.description_4: ¬ßoAll you need is to rediscover the cure's method of manufacture.¬ßr
quest.main.cure.basic.title: Understanding the Basics
quest.main.cure.basic.subtitle: Know Thy Enemy
quest.main.cure.basic.description_1: The facts are simple: Despite society's rapid collapse, a ¬ßbcure¬ßr had been made and was being distributed.
quest.main.cure.basic.description_2: Of course, that doesn't mean you can make more right now, but it wouldn't hurt to have a good stockpile in case of the worst.
quest.main.cure.basic.description_3: At the moment, your best shot of getting your hands on a large quantity would be by looting ¬ßbmedical facilities¬ßr.
quest.main.cure.info_school.title: Gather Research - ¬ßaHighrise Residential District¬ßr
quest.main.cure.info_school.description_: A group of students claim to have rediscovered the method for recreating the cure, but contact with them was lost soon after.
If what they say is true, the research papers should be in the ¬ßbVertical School¬ßr.
quest.main.cure.info_plaza.title: Gather Research - ¬ßaRetail District¬ßr
quest.main.cure.info_plaza.description_1: There are rumors that some scientists managed to take refuge in the ¬ßbTerrace Plaza Mall¬ßr, one of the largest malls in the city.
quest.main.cure.info_plaza.description_2: You may be able to get information on the cure from them... or loot it from where they died.
quest.main.cure.info_courtyard.title: Gather Research - ¬ßaHighrise Office District¬ßr
quest.main.cure.info_courtyard.descripti: The ¬ßbCourtyard Office¬ßr towers above even the skyscrapers of the highrise office district.
Intel suggests a high-ranking office worker staying there has come into possession of research on the cure.
quest.main.cure.info_casino.title: Gather Research - ¬ßaHighrise Hotel District¬ßr
quest.main.cure.info_casino.description_: Rumors suggest a key piece of the cure research is up for for sale at the ¬ßbCasino¬ßr, every gambler‚Äôs favorite place.
Take it for yourself, or find someone who knows where it is.
quest.main.cure.info_lab.title: Gather Research - ¬ßaWasteland¬ßr
quest.main.cure.info_lab.description_1:
¬ßbEND OF CONTENT: This quest cannot yet be completed!¬ßr

Visit the ¬ßbC-07 Laboratory¬ßr and uncover the secrets behind the outbreak. Rumors claim that one of the key ingredients for the cure was produced here.
quest.main.cure.info_lab.description_2: If there is any research on the cure at all, it will definitely be found in there.
quest.main.cure.catalog.title: The Catalog
quest.main.cure.catalog.subtitle: A Brief History of the Cure
quest.main.cure.catalog.description_1: Collecting the papers only further reinforces your suspicions ‚Äî a cure was made, but it was incomplete, only treating the symptoms and doing nothing to prevent re-infection.
quest.main.cure.catalog.description_2: Nonetheless, it can be re-made with the help of a reagent called the ¬ßbX Factor¬ßr, which the papers say contains materials that do not originate from this dimension.
quest.main.cure.catalog.description_3: While the stock of that reagent seems to be limited, there should be enough to make as many apples as you desire ‚Äî assuming you can find it.
quest.main.cure.precursor.title: The Precursor
quest.main.cure.precursor.subtitle: Not Quite Chemical X
quest.main.cure.precursor.description_1: With both the research book and the X Factor, you are finally ready to take on the challenge of manufacturing the cure.
quest.main.cure.precursor.description_2: Automate it if you wish, or just make one trial run ‚Äî the choice is yours.
quest.main.cure.cure.title: The Cure
quest.main.cure.cure.subtitle: The Scenic Route
quest.main.cure.cure.description_1: Combine Formula X with an ordinary apple to make a golden apple.
quest.main.cure.cure.description_2: If you‚Äôve successfully automated things up to this point, congratulations ‚Äî humanity has regained its ability to make a cure for the infection!
quest.main.cure.cure.description_3: However‚Ä¶ without access to the dimension the reagent originates from, the timer has merely been delayed.
quest.main.cure.cure.description_4: ¬ßoPerhaps... perhaps we need to go deeper.¬ßr
quest.main.cure.gasmask.title: Seeking the Source
quest.main.cure.gasmask.subtitle: The Long Journey
quest.main.cure.gasmask.description_1: Rumors say that the outbreak came from another world, the portal to which is hidden in a lab deep in what is now a radioactive wasteland‚Ä¶ but a long journey lies ahead.
quest.main.cure.gasmask.description_2: Craft or trade for a gas mask, or find hazmat suits in hospitals ‚Äî but beware, as they will only last so long.
quest.main.cure.gasmask.description_3: It‚Äôs recommended to bring extra filters for your mask, as you can right-click them while wearing it to repair.
quest.main.cure.find_wasteland.title: The Wasteland
quest.main.cure.find_wasteland.descripti:
¬ßbEND OF CONTENT: The beta does not contain content beyond this point!¬ßr

The source of the apocalypse, the Wasteland is all that remains after both being overrun by infected and the catastrophic meltdown of its many nuclear reactors.
Find the laboratory at the heart of it all, and uncover its secrets...
quest.main.cure.x_factor.title: The X Factor
quest.main.cure.x_factor.subtitle: *buzzer noise*
quest.main.cure.x_factor.description_1:
¬ßbEND OF CONTENT: This quest cannot yet be completed!¬ßr

After the cure was created, many laboratories banded together in hopes of finding a way to speed up the painfully slow production process ‚Äî or substitute the alien materials used entirely.
quest.main.cure.x_factor.description_2: Though their efforts came too late to save themselves, it seems their work was not in vain.
quest.main.cure.x_factor.description_3: While the method of making more of this reagent is now locked behind a deactivated portal, there should be enough of it left here to finish the cure ‚Äî if you have the proper knowledge.
quest.main.abyss.keycard.title: The Keycard
quest.main.abyss.keycard.subtitle: The Key to the Unknown
quest.main.abyss.keycard.description_1:
It was all over the news when the creation of the gateway was completed. A new world, ripe for the picking, just waiting for the next wave of pioneers. 
The beginning of the end, though they could not have known it.
quest.main.abyss.keycard.description_2: The gateway at the heart of the lab now lies shut, and requires an activation key.
quest.main.abyss.origin.title: The Origin
quest.main.abyss.origin.subtitle: Darker Darker Yet Darker
quest.main.abyss.origin.description_1: It is time to traverse the gateway.
quest.main.abyss.origin.description_2: Use the magnetic card on the portal.
quest.main.district.radar.title: Building Radar
quest.main.district.radar.subtitle: DeceasedCraft's most awaited feature...
quest.main.district.radar.title.desc_1: Not sure what building you're at? Or want to find a specific building?
quest.main.district.radar.title.desc_2:
Craft or find a ¬ßbbuilding radar¬ßr and charge it. You can charge it with a battery, or a charging station.

You can loot various flyers which will allow you to search for specific buildings.
quest.main.district.radar.title.desc_3: ¬ßcWARNING:¬ßr Be aware that searching for buildings may cause lag as new chunks are generated!
quest.main.district.survivor_radar.title: Survivor Radar
quest.main.district.survivor_radar.desc_: ¬ßbVillagers¬ßr in DeceasedCraft v5.0 have been ¬ßcremoved¬ßr in favour of ¬ßbspecial quest NPCs¬ßr.
There are ¬ßbseveral¬ßr per ¬ßedistrict¬ßr, and completing their quests will allow you to ¬ßbpurchase items¬ßr from them.
¬ßbNPCs¬ßr can be found with the ¬ßbsurvivor radar¬ßr, a lootable item found in the ¬ßbSuburban Residential¬ßr district, and active ¬ßbNPC quests¬ße¬ßr can be tracked using ¬ß6[F8]¬ßr.
¬ßcNOTE:¬ßr The Survivor Radar only shows NPCs in ¬ßcgenerated chunks¬ßr - you may have to explore more if no signals are found!
A list of all NPCs and which district they can be found is in the ¬ß6District List¬ßr chapter.
quest.main.district.suburb_residential.d: A peaceful neighbourhood of small suburban houses. ¬ßaMild¬ßr temperature. ¬ßaLow¬ßr threat. Your default spawn location.
quest.main.district.highrise_office.desc: A crowded district full of medium to highrise offices. ¬ßeModerate threat¬ßr. ¬ß6Heat¬ßr protection recommended.
quest.main.district.highrise_hotel.title: Highrise Hotel District
quest.main.district.highrise_hotel.descr: An entertainment district dominated by hotels and club venues, crowned by a megatall casino. ¬ßcHigh¬ßr threat. ¬ß6Very hot¬ßr!
quest.main.district.highrise_residential: A crowded highrise residential district. ¬ßeModerate¬ßr threat. ¬ßbCold¬ßr protection recommended.
quest.main.district.retail.title: Retail District
quest.main.district.retail.description: A sprawling retail district, the largest of which is the Terrace Plaza Mall. ¬ßcHigh¬ßr threat. ¬ßbVery cold¬ßr!
quest.main.district.wasteland.title: Wasteland
quest.main.district.wasteland.descriptio: A deadly, desolate district ravaged by both a nuclear reactor meltdown and the viral outbreak. ¬ß4Extreme¬ßr threat. ¬ß4Extreme¬ßr heat.
A gas mask or radiation protection suit is strongly recommended before entering this district.
quest.combat.armor.set_info.title: Armor Set Effects
quest.combat.armor.set_info.subtitle: Gotta collect them all.
quest.combat.armor.set_info.desc_1: Some armor sets will provide a ¬ßbset bonus¬ßr.
quest.combat.armor.set_info.desc_2: You can check the set effect of a piece of armor by hovering over it and pressing ¬ß6[Shift + Ctrl]¬ßr.
quest.combat.armor.repairing.title: Repairing Armor
quest.combat.armor.repairing.subtitle: Anvils are overrated.
quest.combat.armor.repairing.description: All armor can be repaired by ¬ßbhand crafting¬ßr, without needing an anvil. They will keep their upgrades, too!
To repair any piece of armor, you will need their base crafting component. For example, Tier 2 and 3 armors will take a basic or intermediate armor component to repair.
quest.combat.armor.upgrade_part.title: Upgrade Parts
quest.combat.armor.upgrade_part.subtitle: Where did the enchantments go...?
quest.combat.armor.upgrade_part.descript: Enchantments have been rebranded as ¬ßbupgrade parts¬ßr, with a new name and texture.
However, the fundamental mechanic remains the same. Upgrade parts can be found through looting, and combined in an anvil.
¬ßcNOTE:¬ßr The enchanting table has been disabled.
quest.combat.armor.t3_manufacture.title: Advanced Manufacturing
quest.combat.armor.t3_manufacture.desc_1: Tier 3 armors and above must be made using the mechanical crafter.
quest.combat.armor.t1_part.title: Tier I
quest.combat.armor.t1_part.desc_1: ¬ß6Tier 1¬ßr armor is crafted from leather armor, and can be repaired with leather.
quest.combat.armor.t1_leather.title: Leather Armor Set
quest.combat.armor.t1_leather.desc_1: Leather armor forms the basis of all ¬ß6T1¬ßr armor sets.
quest.combat.armor.t1_leather.subtitle: Humble Beginnings
quest.combat.armor.t1_fighter.title: Fighter Set
quest.combat.armor.t1_fighter.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the fighter set.
quest.combat.armor.t1_fighter.subtitle: Punching never felt so good.
quest.combat.armor.t1_nurse.title: Nurse Set
quest.combat.armor.t1_nurse.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the nurse set.
quest.combat.armor.t1_nurse.subtitle: Medic!
quest.combat.armor.t1_hunting.title: Hunting Set
quest.combat.armor.t1_hunting.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the hunting set.
quest.combat.armor.t1_hunting.subtitle: Hack and Slash.
quest.combat.armor.t1_ghillie.title: Ghillie Set
quest.combat.armor.t1_ghillie.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the ghillie set.
quest.combat.armor.t1_ghillie.subtitle: Can't see me.
quest.combat.armor.t1_forestguard.title: Forest Guard Set
quest.combat.armor.t1_forestguard.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the forest guard set.
quest.combat.armor.t1_forestguard.subtit: Remember, only you can stop zombie forest fires.
quest.combat.armor.t1_anarchy.title: Anarchy Set
quest.combat.armor.t1_anarchy.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the anarchy set.
quest.combat.armor.t1_anarchy.subtitle: May the loot be with you.
quest.combat.armor.t1_vanilla.title: Vanilla Set
quest.combat.armor.t1_vanilla.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the vanilla set.
quest.combat.armor.t1_vanilla.subtitle: Vanilla flavored.
quest.combat.armor.t2_part.title: Tier II
quest.combat.armor.t2_part.desc_1: ¬ß6Tier 2¬ßr armor is crafted from chainmail armor, and can be repaired with basic armor components.
quest.combat.armor.t2_part.desc_2: Basic armor components and the blueprint to make them can be looted from Tier 2 districts.
quest.combat.armor.t2_chainmail.title: Chainmail Armor Set
quest.combat.armor.t2_chainmail.desc_1: Chainmail armor forms the basis of all ¬ß6T2¬ßr armor sets.
quest.combat.armor.t2_chainmail.subtitle: Back to the medieval era.
quest.combat.armor.t2_football.title: Football Set
quest.combat.armor.t2_football.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the football set.
quest.combat.armor.t2_football.subtitle: Touchdown!
quest.combat.armor.t2_general.title: Army General Set
quest.combat.armor.t2_general.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the army general set.
quest.combat.armor.t2_general.subtitle: Attention!
quest.combat.armor.t2_police.title: Police Set
quest.combat.armor.t2_police.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the police set.
quest.combat.armor.t2_police.subtitle: Giving zombies the good old beatdown.
quest.combat.armor.t2_firefighter.title: Firefighter Set
quest.combat.armor.t2_firefighter.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the firefighter set.
quest.combat.armor.t2_construction.title: Construction Worker Set
quest.combat.armor.t2_construction.desc_: Obtain a piece of the construction worker set.
quest.combat.armor.t2_royal.title: Royal Canada Police Officer Set
quest.combat.armor.t2_royal.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the royal canada police officer armor set.
quest.combat.armor.t2_royal.subtitle: It's got a little.. je ne sais quoi.
quest.combat.armor.t3_part.title: Tier III
quest.combat.armor.t3_part.desc_1: ¬ß6Tier 3¬ßr armor is crafted from steel armor, and can be repaired with intermediate armor components.
quest.combat.armor.t3_part.desc_2: Intermediate armor components and the blueprint to make them can be looted from Tier 3 districts.
quest.combat.armor.t3_steel.title: Steel Armor Set
quest.combat.armor.t3_steel.desc_1: Steel armor forms the basis of all ¬ß6T3¬ßr armor sets.
quest.combat.armor.t3_steel.subtitle: Feels a bit heavy.
quest.combat.armor.t3_militaryriot.title: Military Riot Set
quest.combat.armor.t3_militaryriot.desc_: Obtain a piece of the military riot armor set.
quest.combat.armor.t3_urban.title: Military Urban Set
quest.combat.armor.t3_urban.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the military urban armor set.
quest.combat.armor.t3_urban.subtitle: Close-quarters combat.
quest.combat.armor.t3_un.title: UN Set
quest.combat.armor.t3_un.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the UN armor set.
quest.combat.armor.t3_un.subtitle: World peace.
quest.combat.armor.t3_army.title: Army Set
quest.combat.armor.t3_army.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the army set.
quest.combat.armor.t3_army.subtitle: Taking the fight to them.
quest.combat.armor.t3_hazmat.title: Hazmat Suit Set
quest.combat.armor.t3_hazmat.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the hazmat suit set.
quest.combat.armor.t3_hazmat.subtitle: Jesse, we need to cook!
quest.combat.armor.t3_gasmask.title: Gas Mask
quest.combat.armor.t3_gasmask.subtitle: Not great, not terrible.
quest.combat.armor.t3_gasmask.desc_1: Crafting a gas mask allows you to safely access the wasteland.
quest.combat.armor.t3_gasmask.desc_2: However, it provides negligible head protection. It is recommended to upgrade to a better alternative as soon as possible!
quest.combat.armor.t4_part.title: Tier IV
quest.combat.armor.t4_part.desc_1: ¬ß6Tier 4¬ßr armor is crafted from netherite armor, and can be repaired with advanced armor components.
quest.combat.armor.t4_part.desc_2: Advanced armor components and the blueprint to make them can be looted from ¬ß6Tier 4¬ßr districts.
quest.combat.armor.t4_netherite.title: Netherite Armor Set
quest.combat.armor.t4_netherite.desc_1: Netherite armor and its sets form the ¬ß6endgame tier¬ßr for this modpack.
quest.combat.armor.t4_netherite.subtitle: Wait... what's the Nether?
quest.combat.armor.t4_swat_riot.title: Swat Riot Set
quest.combat.armor.t4_swat_riot.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the swat riot armor set.
quest.combat.armor.t4_swat_riot.subtitle: Zombies aren't protestors,,, but this will do fine too.
quest.combat.armor.t4_swat.title: Swat Set
quest.combat.armor.t4_swat.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the swat armor set.
quest.combat.armor.t4_swat.subtitle: FBI! Open up!
quest.combat.armor.t4_soldier.title: Soldier Set
quest.combat.armor.t4_soldier.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the soldier armor set.
quest.combat.armor.t4_soldier.subtitle: Firepower for Freedom
quest.combat.armor.t4_bomb_squad.title: Bomb Squad Set
quest.combat.armor.t4_bomb_squad.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the bomb squad armor set.
quest.combat.armor.t4_spec_ops.title: Spec Ops Set
quest.combat.armor.t4_spec_ops.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the spec ops armor set.
quest.combat.armor.t4_spec_ops.subtitle: Hold the line.
quest.combat.armor.t4_juggernaut.title: Juggernaut Set
quest.combat.armor.t4_juggernaut.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the juggernaut armor set.
quest.combat.armor.t4_biohazard.title: Biohazard Set
quest.combat.armor.t4_biohazard.desc_1: Obtain a piece of the biohazard armor set.
quest.combat.armor.t4_biohazard.subtitle: Mr.White, I think we've cooked too much...
quest.combat.melee.throwing.title: Throwing
quest.combat.melee.throwing.subtitle: YEET!
quest.combat.melee.throwing.description_: You can throw melee weapons by pressing ¬ß6[R]¬ßr.
Thrown weapons deal ¬ßbtwice¬ßr as much damage to enemies.
quest.combat.melee.repairing.title: Repairing Weapons
quest.combat.melee.repairing.subtitle: Anvils are overrated.
quest.combat.melee.repairing.description: All weapons can be repaired by hand crafting, without needing an anvil. ¬ßbThey will keep their upgrades, too!¬ßr
To repair any weapon, you will need their base crafting component. For example, Tier 2 and 3 weapons will take iron or steel ingots to repair.
quest.combat.melee.t1.title: Tier 1 - Wood/Wool
quest.combat.melee.t1.description_1: Tier one weapons can be repaired with ¬ßbwool¬ßr.
quest.combat.melee.t2.title: Tier 2 - Iron
quest.combat.melee.t2.description_1: Tier two weapons can be repaired with ¬ßbiron¬ßr.
quest.combat.melee.t3.title: Tier 3 - Steel
quest.combat.melee.t3.description_1: Tier three weapons can be repaired with ¬ßbsteel¬ßr.
quest.combat.melee.t4.title: Tier 4 - Netherite
quest.combat.melee.t4.description_1: Tier four weapons can be repaired with ¬ßbnetherite scrap¬ßr.
quest.combat.guns.gun_shots.title: Gunshot Sounds
quest.combat.guns.gun_shots.description_: Gunshots ¬ßcattract nearby zombies¬ßr! Be careful when using your guns.
Attaching a ¬ßbsilencer¬ßr will reduce the range of sound created drastically.
quest.combat.guns.gun_durability.title: Gun Durability
quest.combat.guns.gun_durability.descrip: Guns ¬ßctake damage¬ßr over time and must be repaired at an ¬ßbanvil¬ßr with their respective parts.

While they ¬ßbwill not break¬ßr at ¬ß60%¬ßr durability, they will ¬ßcdo less damage¬ßr, ¬ßctake longer to reload¬ßr and are ¬ßcless accurate¬ßr after their durability drops below ¬ß630%¬ßr.

This degradation maxes out at a ¬ßc50% reduction¬ßr of stats at  ¬ß60%¬ßr durability, so keep those guns well maintained!
quest.combat.guns.workbench.title: Gunsmith Table
quest.combat.guns.workbench.subtitle: I need guns. Lots of guns.
quest.combat.guns.workbench.description_: All guns can be crafted at the ¬ßbgunsmith table¬ßr.
quest.combat.guns.ammo_assembly.title: Ammo Assembly Table
quest.combat.guns.ammo_assembly.subtitle: It costs 400,000 dollars...
quest.combat.guns.ammo_assembly.descript: All ammo types can be crafted at the ¬ßbammo assembly table¬ßr.
¬ßbNOTE:¬ßr Consider automating ammo production if you plan to use a lot of ammo!
quest.combat.guns.attachment_table.title: Attachment Table
quest.combat.guns.attachment_table.descr:
Weapon attachments can be crafted at the ¬ßbattachment table¬ßr.
To know what kind of attachments your weapon can support, press ¬ß6[F]¬ßr while looking at the attachment table with your weapon equipped!
quest.combat.guns.casing.title: Bullet Casings
quest.combat.guns.casing.subtitle: Saving your brass.
quest.combat.guns.casing.description_1: Firing a bullet will drop its ¬ßbcasing¬ßr. This can be ¬ßbrecycled¬ßr into more bullets with some gunpowder and lead nuggets on the gunsmith table.
quest.combat.guns.casing.description_2: ¬ßbNOTE:¬ßr Consider automating the recycling of bullet casings back into ammo!
quest.combat.guns.ammobox.title: Ammo Boxes
quest.combat.guns.ammobox.subtitle: Compact bullet storage.
quest.combat.guns.ammobox.description_1: ¬ßbAmmo boxes¬ßr can be crafted for storing multiple stacks of a ¬ßbsingle¬ßr type of ammo, saving space.
quest.combat.guns.ammobox.description_2: Different tiers of ammo boxes can store more stacks of each type of ammo. Iron can store ¬ß63¬ßr stacks, Gold can store ¬ß66¬ßr stacks, and Diamond can store ¬ß69¬ßr stacks.
quest.combat.guns.attachment.description: Attachment Parts can be found in ¬ßbhigh security¬ßr areas.
quest.combat.guns.pistol.description_1: Pistol Parts can be found in the ¬ßeSuburb Residential¬ßr district.
quest.combat.guns.smg.description_1: SMG Parts can be found in the ¬ßeHighrise Office¬ßr district.
quest.combat.guns.shotgun.description_1: Shotgun Parts can be found in the ¬ßeHighrise Residential¬ßr district.
quest.combat.guns.rifle.description_1: Rifle Parts can be found in the ¬ßeHighrise Hotel¬ßr or ¬ßeRetail¬ßr district.
quest.combat.guns.sniper.description_1: Sniper Parts can be found in the ¬ßeWasteland¬ßr.
quest.combat.guns.hmg.description_1: HMG Parts can be found in the ¬ßeWasteland¬ßr.
quest.combat.guns.special.description_1: Special Parts can be found in the ¬ßeAbyss¬ßr.
quest.combat.defense.automated_defense.s: Not quite a tower defense game
quest.combat.defense.automated_defense.d: Advanced electronic components are crucial for higher tier equipment.
Creating them will be covered elsewhere, but they are also used to make automated weapons for base defense.
quest.combat.defense.tesla.title: Tower Defense - Tesla Turret
quest.combat.defense.tesla.description_1: Tesla coils consume a large amount of electricity to deliver lethal electric shocks to nearby targets.
quest.combat.defense.tesla.description_2: Be sure to consult the Engineer's Manual for specifics on how to configure these turrets!
quest.combat.defense.flame_turret.title: Tower Defense - Flame Turret
quest.combat.defense.flame_turret.descri: The chemthrower turret shoots a burning stream of fire to set enemies alight.
A list of ignitable fuels can be found below this entry.
Be sure to consult the Engineer's Manual for specifics on how to configure these turrets!
quest.combat.defense.gun_turret.title: Tower Defense - Gun Turret
quest.combat.defense.gun_turret.descript: The gun turret does exactly what it says it does; shoot things.
Crafting of the ammo required is briefly explained to the right of this entry.
Be sure to consult the Engineer's Manual for specifics on how to configure these turrets!
quest.combat.defense.casing.title: Casing Mold
quest.combat.defense.casing.description_: You'll need this specific mold to be able to craft ammunition for gun turrets.
Alternatively, you can also manually craft the casings, though at a much higher resource cost.
quest.combat.defense.empty_casing.descri: Press copper ingots in a metal press using a mold to obtain the required casings.
Or, craft copper plates in a crafting table.
quest.combat.defense.turret_ammunition.d: A list of ammunition types and their effects can be found in the Engineer's Manual under [Tools > Revolver Cartridges].
quest.combat.defense.bigcannon.title: Create: Big Cannons
quest.combat.defense.bigcannon.subtitle: Firepower for Freedom
quest.combat.defense.bigcannon.descripti: The mod Create Big Cannons allows for the creation of heavy artillery pieces.
The method to do so, however, will not be explained here and is left as an exercise to you...
quest.combat.defense.barbed_wire.title: Barbed Wire
quest.combat.defense.barbed_wire.descrip: Barbed wire allows easier base defense by slowing and damaging any attacking horde.
quest.combat.defense.razor_wire.title: Razor Wire
quest.combat.defense.razor_wire.subtitle: Poke and electrocute them till they die.
quest.combat.defense.razor_wire.descript: Once you have access to steel, razor wire provides all the benefits of barbed wire, but has the added bonus of being able to be connected by wire to your electrical grid.
quest.combat.defense.wirecutter.title: Wire Cutting
quest.combat.defense.wirecutter.subtitle: Snip Snap
quest.combat.defense.wirecutter.descript: Razor wire requires the use of wirecutters to remove safely without hurting you.
quest.combat.defense.powder.title: Can of Powder
quest.combat.defense.powder.subtitle: A little boom in a box.
quest.combat.defense.powder.description_: A can of gunpowder is useful for a lot of things...
Check what can be crafted using it for non-trap related explosive recipes.
quest.combat.defense.land_mine.title: Land Mines
quest.combat.defense.land_mine.subtitle: The classic explosive.
quest.combat.defense.land_mine.descripti: Things step on it; it explodes. A pretty straightforward trap.
Check what can be crafted using it for non-trap related explosive recipes.
quest.combat.defense.smart_mine.title: Smart Mines
quest.combat.defense.smart_mine.subtitle: Now with less friendly fire!
quest.combat.defense.smart_mine.descript: Securitycraft mines can be remotely activated, and have the added bonus of recognizing its owner.
quest.combat.defense.bouncy_mine.title: Bouncy Mines
quest.combat.defense.bouncy_mine.descrip: Otherwise identical to its normal cousin, this Securitycraft mine jumps up before exploding, for some reason...
quest.combat.defense.bomb_defuse.title: Bomb Defusing
quest.combat.defense.bomb_defuse.descrip: Normal explosive traps can be disarmed and picked up by using a defusing kit.
quest.combat.defense.advance_bomb_defuse: Securitycraft mines can be configured, remotely activated, or disarmed using this tool.
quest.tech.intro.title: Introduction To Technology
quest.tech.intro.subtitle: Time to get your thinking hats on.
quest.tech.intro.description_1: Many of the more advanced materials in this modpack can be manufactured instead of looted.
quest.tech.intro.description_2: To do so will require the use of two tech mods, ¬ß6Create¬ßr and ¬ß6Immersive Engineering¬ßr.
quest.tech.intro.description_3: ¬ßcNOTE:¬ßr While this guidebook will walk you though the basics, it is recommended to use either the in-game guides for the respective mods, or learn them from online.
quest.tech.treated.create.title: Create Engineering
quest.tech.treated.create.subtitle: Getting stressed...
quest.tech.treated.create.description_1: Create is used in all stages of progression, especially mid-tier items and equipment, as well as for ammo production.
quest.tech.treated.create.description_2: The simplest way to understand how create machines work is to hover your cursor over the item and hold ¬ß6[W]¬ßr to ponder.
quest.tech.treated.mechanical_crafter.de: You should aim to set up at least a mechanical crafting system past the mid-tier, as it is used for many recipes.
Mechanical crafters can be looted in the city, or crafted. Remember to use ¬ß6[W]¬ßr to Ponder for a detailed guide on how to use them!
quest.tech.treated.engineer.title: Immersive Engineering
quest.tech.treated.engineer.subtitle: You get a multiblock, and you get a multiblock...
quest.tech.treated.engineer.description_: Immersive Engineering is crucial in creating and automating late game materials.
It is recommended you consult their ¬ßbmanual¬ßr if you're ever stuck about how to use a machine.
quest.tech.treated.schematic.title: Schematic Table
quest.tech.treated.schematic.subtitle: A Holographic Guide
quest.tech.treated.schematic.description: The schematic table allows you to display multiblock buildings layer by layer - as well as showing where you may have placed or used incorrect blocks.
Place paper into the slot and select the building you want to make.

Once you've made the schematic, hold ¬ß6[Shift + Right Click]¬ßr on the ground to mark the location you want to build. After that, placing the schematic on your offhand will show a hologram of the structure.
quest.tech.treated.andesite.title: Andesite Alloy
quest.tech.treated.andesite.subtitle: Starting With Create
quest.tech.treated.andesite.description_: Andesite Alloy is the base material for most Create contraptions.
It is crafted from andesite and iron or zinc nuggets.
While it is possible to automate andesite production using lava, gravel and flint, looting buildings for create components may be faster.
quest.tech.treated.shaft.title: Shafts
quest.tech.treated.shaft.description_1: Shafts allow for power to be transferred in a straight line.
quest.tech.treated.shaft.description_2: Remember to use ¬ß6[W]¬ßr to Ponder for a detailed guide on how to use them!
quest.tech.treated.cogwheel.title: Cogwheels
quest.tech.treated.cogwheel.description_: Cogwheels allow transferring power to adjacent cogwheels.
Remember to use ¬ß6[W]¬ßr to Ponder for a detailed guide on how to use them!
quest.tech.treated.crank.title: Hand Crank
quest.tech.treated.crank.description_1: The hand crank is the most basic power source for Create. It is very weak, but should allow you to run the simplest machines.
quest.tech.treated.crank.description_2: For better power sources, we recommend checking out the Power Generation section in the questbook.
quest.tech.treated.crank.description_3: Remember to use ¬ß6[W]¬ßr to Ponder for a detailed guide on how to use them!
quest.tech.treated.gearbox.title: Gearboxes
quest.tech.treated.gearbox.description_1: Gearboxes allow power to change directions.
quest.tech.treated.gearbox.description_2: Remember to use ¬ß6[W]¬ßr to Ponder for a detailed guide on how to use them!
quest.tech.treated.learning.title: Create Mastery
quest.tech.treated.learning.subtitle: So much potential, so little time...
quest.tech.treated.learning.description_: There are many things you can automate with Create alone, but we cannot go through them all here.
If you're interested in learning more, you can find Create items on EMI using the keyword ¬ßb@create¬ßr and ponder them using ¬ß6[W]¬ßr, or check out guides online.
Some useful things to set up from here on are a power generation source, as well as mechanical crafting.
quest.tech.treated.goldplate.title: Gold Plate
quest.tech.treated.goldplate.description: You can get gold plates by looting, or by using the ¬ßbEngineer's Hammer¬ßr from Immersive Engineering on a gold ingot.
quest.tech.treated.wrench.title: Wrench
quest.tech.treated.wrench.description_1: The Wrench is a very useful tool for rotating and dismantling Create mechanisms. It is recommended you get one as soon as possible if you plan to build a lot of Create devices.
quest.tech.treated.sandstone.title: Sandstone
quest.tech.treated.sandstone.description: Find sandstone from deserts, craft it from sand, or grind gravel into sand using Create.
quest.tech.treated.engineers_hammer.desc: The Engineer's Hammer allows you to turn ingots into plates, which are used for many Immersive Engineering recipes.
It also is the final step in assembling multiblock machines.
The Engineer's Wire Cutters allow you to turn plates into wires. Copper wire spools are a cheap way to transfer energy between machines.
quest.tech.treated.clay.title: Clay
quest.tech.treated.clay.description_1: Clay deposits can be found near rivers and in oceans.
quest.tech.treated.brick.description_1: Some clay will need to be smelted to become bricks. Make sure to keep enough, as the coke brick recipe uses them in a 1:1 ratio.
quest.tech.treated.coke_brick.descriptio: Craft a coke brick using clay, bricks, and sandstone.
quest.tech.treated.coke_oven.title: Coke Oven
quest.tech.treated.coke_oven.description: Check the Engineer's Manual for how to create a coke oven under ¬ß6[Workbenches And Furnaces > Coke Oven]¬ßr
quest.tech.treated.creosote.description_: Burn logs, coal or charcoal to obtain creosote oil.
You can take it out using a bucket.
quest.tech.treated.torch_production.desc: One of the new recipes added by this modpack lets you craft torches in bulk using creosote and wool.
See if you can find it!
quest.tech.treated.planks.subtitle: Wood you look at that...
quest.tech.treated.planks.description_1: Craft treated wood planks by combining planks with creosote oil.
quest.tech.treated.planks.description_2: Treated wood forms the basis for ¬ß6many¬ßr Immersive Engineering machines. Be sure to check what can be crafted using it!
quest.tech.treated.coal_coke.subtitle: The Fuel of the Future
quest.tech.treated.coal_coke.description: A byproduct of the production of creosote oil is coal coke, which is an excellent fuel.
It is highly recommended to use this for creating steel.
quest.tech.steel.netherrack.description_: Netherrack can typically be found in destroyed buildings in the city.
Alternatively, it can be found underground in volcanic biomes.
quest.tech.steel.nether_brick.descriptio: Smelt netherrack to obtain nether bricks.
quest.tech.steel.blast_brick.description: Craft ¬ßbblast bricks¬ßr using nether bricks, regular bricks, and magma blocks.
quest.tech.steel.magma_block.description:
Magma blocks can typically be found in destroyed buildings in the city.

Alternatively, it can be found in volcanic biomes.
quest.tech.steel.blast_furnace.title: Blast Furnace
quest.tech.steel.blast_furnace.descripti: Check the Engineer's Manual for how to create a blast furnace under ¬ß6[Workbenches And Furnaces > Blast Furnace]¬ßr
quest.tech.steel.ingot.title: Steel Ingot
quest.tech.steel.ingot.subtitle: Moving up the tech tree...
quest.tech.steel.ingot.description_1: Iron can be smelted into steel in the blast furnace using coke.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.squeezer.de: Check the Engineer's Manual for how to create a Squeezer under ¬ß6[Heavy Machinery > Squeezer]¬ßr
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.plantoil.de: Obtain plant oil by squeezing plants in the Squeezer.
A list of squeezable plants can be found in the Engineer's Manual under ¬ß6[Heavy Machinery > Squeezer]¬ßr
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.rubber_base: Mix plant oil and phenolic resin in a heated Create basin to create rubber base.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.phenolic_re: Refine Acetaldehyde with Creosote Oil in the Refinery to obtain Phenolic Resin.
Phenolic Resin is used in many materials, so be sure to keep a good stock!
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.refinery.de: Check the Engineer's Manual for how to create a refinery under ¬ß6[Heavy Machinery > Refinery]¬ßr
The Refinery is used for quite a few advanced materials, consider making one to handle each step of the process!
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.acetaldehyd: Refine ethanol into acetaldehyde in the Refinery using a silver plate as the catalyst.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.fermenter.s: Was there an alcohol recipe? I can't remember...
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.fermenter.d: Check the Engineer's Manual for how to create a Fermenter under ¬ß6[Heavy Machinery > Fermenter]¬ßr
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.ethanol.des: Obtain ethanol by fermenting plants in the Fermenter.
A list of fermentable plants can be found in the Engineer's Manual under ¬ß6[Heavy Machinery > Fermenter]¬ßr
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.duroplast.s: If Plastic is so good why didn't they make a Plastic-2
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.duroplast.d: Obtain duroplast by bottling phenolic resin in a Bottling Machine using a ¬ßbMetal Press Mold: Plate.¬ßr
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.redstone_ac: Mix redstone dust and water to obtain redstone acid.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.rubber.desc: Mix rubber base and redstone acid in a heated Create basin to create rubber.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.high_resist: Mix molten nethersteel and phenolic resin in a ¬ßesuperheated¬ßr Create basin to create high-resistance fiber.
Oh, while we're at it, we made Cloth 2, too
Craft four high resistance fibers together to create high-resistance fabric.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.molten_neth: Break nethersteel into nethersteel nuggets, then melt the nuggets in a heated Create basin with a Foundry Lid to create molten nethersteel.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.nethersteel: Mix netherite scrap and cast iron ingots in a ¬ßesuperheated¬ßr Create basin to create nethersteel.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.cast_iron_i: Uncraft a cast iron block to obtain cast iron ingots.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.cast_iron_b: Compact an iron block in a heated Create basin to create cast iron blocks.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.netherite_s: Netherite scrap can be obtained by looting.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.highcarbons: Obtain High-Carbon Steel Alloy by melting steel ingots, a block of coal coke, and netherite scrap in an Arc Furnace.
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.arc_furnace: Check the Engineer's Manual for how to create an arc furnace under ¬ß6[Heavy Machinery > Arc Furnace]¬ßr
quest.tech.advancedmaterials.coal_coke_b: Craft coal coke into a block. This shouldn't be too hard.
quest.storage.intro.title: Refined Storage
quest.storage.intro.subtitle: No more chest spam.
quest.storage.intro.desc_1: Refined Storage is a mod that allows for bulk storage of items in a compact space, as long as you have enough storage space and power.
quest.storage.intro.desc_2: This chapter will walk you through the basics of how to set up a simple storage system.
quest.storage.intro.desc_3: For more advanced things you could do, make sure to check out the Refined Storage advancements under ¬ß6[Escape > Advancements > Refined Storage]¬ßr
quest.storage.silicon.title: Silicon
quest.storage.silicon.desc_1: Silicon is needed in bulk for many Refined Storage blocks. You will need to set up an arc furnace to create it yourself, or scrap existing Refined Storage components using the ¬ßbScrapping Table¬ßr.
quest.storage.silicon.desc_2: Many Refined Storage blocks can also be found as loot in the city - trading or looting the required blocks may be faster than crafting them.
quest.storage.processor_basic.title: Basic Processor
quest.storage.processor_basic.desc_1: Basic processors are used to make construction and destruction cores, which are used in blocks that interact with the world (importers/exporters/grids).
quest.storage.processor_basic.desc_2: ¬ßcNOTE:¬ßr Crafting this component is a very complex process - consider trading for or looting them instead!
quest.storage.processor_improved.title: Improved Processor
quest.storage.processor_improved.desc_1: Improved processors are used to make importers,exporters, and many advanced blocks.
quest.storage.processor_improved.desc_2: ¬ßcNOTE:¬ßr Crafting this component is a very complex process - consider trading for or looting them instead!
quest.storage.processor_advanced.title: Advanced Processor
quest.storage.processor_advanced.desc_1: Advanced processors are used to make the Controller, the heart of a refined storage system.
quest.storage.processor_advanced.desc_2: ¬ßcNOTE:¬ßr Crafting this component is a very complex process - consider trading for or looting them instead!
quest.storage.controller.title: The Controller
quest.storage.controller.subtitle: Shiny...
quest.storage.controller.desc_1: Every Refined Storage system requires a controller. This acts as the battery for the system, and can be powered from any side. It will light up if set up correctly.
quest.storage.controller.desc_2: ¬ßbWhile this block can be crafted, it is also available as loot in the city.¬ßr
quest.storage.machine_casing.title: Machine Casing
quest.storage.machine_casing.desc_1: Machine Casings are used to make many blocks in the mod, including the Controller.
quest.storage.machine_casing.desc_2: ¬ßbWhile this block can be crafted, it is also available as loot in the city.¬ßr
quest.storage.discdrive.title: The Disk Drive
quest.storage.discdrive.subtitle: You'd think we found something better than floppy disks...
quest.storage.discdrive.desc_1: Every Refined Storage system also requires a disk drive. The disk drive can fit up to 8 storage disks, which determine how many items your storage system can hold.
quest.storage.discdrive.desc_2: Place it next to the controller, or connected by cable. If set up correctly, the inserted disks will light up.
quest.storage.discdrive.desc_3: ¬ßbWhile this block can be crafted, it is also available as loot in the city.¬ßr
quest.storage.grid.title: The Grid
quest.storage.grid.subtitle: *tron music*
quest.storage.grid.desc_1: The Grid is the last required part of the Refined Storage system, and allows storing and retrieving of items inside.
quest.storage.grid.desc_2: Place it next to the controller, or connected by cable. If set up correctly, the screen will light up.
quest.storage.grid.desc_3: ¬ßbWhile this block can be crafted, it is also available as loot in the city.¬ßr
quest.storage.craftinggrid.title: The Crafting Grid
quest.storage.craftinggrid.subtitle: The power of creation in the palm of your hand.
quest.storage.craftinggrid.desc_1: While optional, it is recommended you upgrade your Grid to a Crafting Grid as soon as possible.
quest.storage.craftinggrid.desc_2: The Crafting Grid allows access to a crafting table inside the storage system, allowing you to craft using any items stored inside.
quest.storage.craftinggrid.desc_3: ¬ßbWhile this block can be crafted, it is also available as loot in the city.¬ßr
quest.storage.storage_parts.title: Storage Parts
quest.storage.storage_parts.desc_1: Storage parts are used to craft Storage Disks, which determine the amount of items you can store in your storage system.
quest.storage.storage_parts.desc_2: They can be upgraded into higher tiers, which store more items: ¬ß61k >4k >16k > 64k¬ßr
quest.storage.storage_parts.desc_3: ¬ßcNOTE:¬ßr Crafting this component is a very complex process - consider trading for or looting them instead!
quest.storage.storage_disks.title: Storage Disks
quest.storage.storage_disks.desc_1: Craft storage parts into Storage Disks, then slot them into the Disk Drive. These disks are where your items are actually stored - ¬ßcdon't lose them¬ßr!
quest.storage.storage_disks.desc_2: If you're upgrading, you can remove storage parts from empty disks using ¬ß6[Shift-Right Click]¬ßr with a disk in your hand!
quest.storage.storage_disks.desc_3: Disks can also be looted or traded for.
quest.storage.cores.title: Construction and Destruction Cores
quest.storage.cores.desc_1: Construction and Destruction Cores are used in blocks that interact with the world (importers/exporters/grids).
quest.storage.cores.desc_2: You will need at least one of each if you're building the system from scratch, as they are used to make the Grid.
quest.storage.importer.title: Importing Items
quest.storage.importer.desc_1: Importers will automatically pull items from the inventory it is connected to into the storage system.
quest.storage.importer.desc_2: The items imported can be controlled by placing the desired items in its slot or by using a filter.
quest.storage.exporter.title: Exporting Items
quest.storage.exporter.desc_1: Exporters will automatically send items from storage system into the inventory it is connected to.
quest.storage.exporter.desc_2: Unlike importers, exporters will not export items unless you tell it what to send by placing the desired item in its slot.
quest.tech.power.introduction.title: The Industrial Age
quest.tech.power.introduction.subtitle: Power, Infinite Power!
quest.tech.power.introduction.descriptio: Both Create and Immersive Engineering use different types of power, ¬ßbStress Units (SU)¬ßr and ¬ßbForge Energy (FE)¬ßr. This section of the guide serves as an introduction to the methods of power generation available in both mods.
Make sure to consult the Engineer's Manual ¬ß6[Power,Wires,Generators > Power Generation]¬ßr as well as use Create's ponder feature for more detailed descriptions.
quest.tech.power.motor.title: Electric Motor
quest.tech.power.motor.subtitle: FE > SU
quest.tech.power.motor.description_1: The motor allows for conversion of ¬ßbFE¬ßr to ¬ßbSU¬ßr. Ponder it ¬ß6[W]¬ßr for more information.
quest.tech.power.alternator.title: Electric Alternator
quest.tech.power.alternator.subtitle: SU > FE
quest.tech.power.alternator.description_: The alternator allows for conversion of ¬ßbSU¬ßr to ¬ßbFE¬ßr. Ponder it ¬ß6[W]¬ßr for more information.
quest.tech.power.steam_engine.title: Steam Engine
quest.tech.power.steam_engine.subtitle: Age of Steam
quest.tech.power.steam_engine.descriptio: The ¬ßbsteam engine¬ßr is Create's mid tier power generator, requiring a heat source and water.
Ponder ¬ß6[W]¬ßr the steam engine block for assembly instructions.
quest.tech.power.diesel.title: Diesel and Biodiesel
quest.tech.power.diesel.subtitle: A more efficient fuel
quest.tech.power.diesel.description_1: The more powerful generators in this modpack require either diesel or biodiesel as fuel.
quest.tech.power.diesel.description_2: Diesel can be refined from ¬ßbcrude oil¬ßr, which can be extracted using Create's ¬ßbPumpjack.¬ßr Be sure to ponder its blocks to learn how to set it up.
quest.tech.power.diesel.description_3: Biodiesel can be refined from ¬ßbethanol¬ßr and ¬ßbseed oil¬ßr, which come from fermenting plants and crushing seeds using Immersive Engineering's ¬ßbFermenter¬ßr and ¬ßbSqueezer¬ßr.
quest.tech.power.diesel_generator.title: Diesel Generator
quest.tech.power.diesel_generator.descri: Immersive Engineering's ¬ßbDiesel Generator¬ßr is a multiblock structure that can be found in some buildings.
A detailed explanation of how to set it up can be found in the Engineer's Manual ¬ß6[Power,Wires,Generators > Diesel Generator]¬ßr.
quest.tech.power.diesel_engine.title: Diesel Engine
quest.tech.power.diesel_engine.descripti: The ¬ßbDiesel Engine¬ßr is the lowest tier of Create's diesel generators. Fuel can be pumped into it from the bottom.
Make sure to Ponder ¬ß6[W]¬ßr the block for assembly and usage instructions!
quest.tech.power.diesel_engine_modular.d: The ¬ßbModular Diesel Engine¬ßr is the middle tier of Create's diesel generators. Fuel can be pumped into it from the top.
Make sure to Ponder ¬ß6[W]¬ßr the block for assembly and usage instructions!
quest.tech.power.diesel_engine_large.des: The ¬ßbLarge Diesel Engine¬ßr is the top tier Create diesel generator. Fuel can be pumped into it from the top.
Make sure to Ponder ¬ß6[W]¬ßr the block for assembly and usage instructions!
quest.tech.power.engineer_goggles.title: Engineer's Goggles
quest.tech.power.engineer_goggles.subtit: The numbers... what do they mean?
quest.tech.power.engineer_goggles.descri: Creating and wearing a set of ¬ßbEngineer's Goggles¬ßr will allow you to visualize the ¬ßbStress Units (SU)¬ßr used and generated by your contraptions.
quest.tech.power.kinetic_dynamo.title: Kinetic Dynamo
quest.tech.power.kinetic_dynamo.subtitle: You spin me right round baby...
quest.tech.power.kinetic_dynamo.descript: Immersive Engineering's watermills and windmills have to be attached to a ¬ßbkinetic dynamo¬ßr in order to generate power.
quest.tech.power.create_waterwheel.title: Water Wheel - Create
quest.tech.power.create_waterwheel.descr: Place waterwheels in flowing water to start generating power. Use ¬ßbshafts¬ßr and ¬ßbcogs¬ßr to move the power where you need it.
quest.tech.power.create_large_waterwheel: The large version of the waterwheel allows more power to be generated from flowing water.
quest.tech.power.immersive_waterwheel.de: Place waterwheels in flowing water to start generating power. Use ¬ßbwire connectors¬ßr and ¬ßbwires¬ßr attached to the kinetic dynamo to move the power where you need it.
quest.tech.power.create_windmill.title: Windmill - Create
quest.tech.power.create_windmill.descrip: Create's windmills require a ¬ß6windmill bearing¬ßr. Craft and Ponder ¬ß6[W]¬ßr it for more information.
quest.tech.power.create_windmill_sail.de: Windmill sails have to be attached to the windmill bearing. More sails will increase the amount of SU generated.
quest.tech.power.immersive_windmill.desc: Must be attached to a kinetic dynamo. Make sure to consult the Engineer's Manual ¬ß6[Power,Wires,Generators > Power Generation]¬ßr for more information!
quest.tech.power.immersive_windmill_sail: Why did we make a windmill with holes anyways?
Windmill sails have to be attached to the windmill. More sails will increase the amount of SU generated.
quest.tech.power.thermoelectric_generato: Thermoelectric generators use the difference in temperature of the two blocks to either side of it to generate power
A list of blocks that can be used can be found in the Engineer's Manual ¬ß6[Power,Wires,Generators > Thermoelectric Generator]¬ßr.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.subtitle: For advanced tech players.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.lava.title: Lava Source
quest.tech.bullet_automation.lava.descri: Lava should be easy enough to obtain, right?
quest.tech.bullet_automation.water.title: Water Source
quest.tech.bullet_automation.water.descr: Water is even easier to obtain.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.cobblestone: Create and automate a cobblestone generator.
An easy way is to do this with create drills.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.tree.title: Planting Trees
quest.tech.bullet_automation.tree.descri: Obtain any sapling and start planting trees.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.logs.title: Logs
quest.tech.bullet_automation.logs.subtit: Cut down trees with a mechanical saw.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.logs.descri: Consider automating this for power generation as well.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.charcoal.de: Create allows you to do this using encased fans and lava, make sure to ponder [W] on the entry for fans.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.blaze_rod.d: Blaze rods can be found by killing blazes in volcanic biomes.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.recycle_rod: Press blaze powder into blaze rods.
Craft or obtain a rod mold and use it in a press to convert blaze powder back into blaze rods.
