quest.tech.bullet_automation.blaze_powde: Crush blaze rods into blaze powder.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.sulfur.subt: Crush blaze rods into sulfur dust.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.sulfur.desc: Sulfur is obtained as a byproduct of crushing blaze rods.
Alternatively, it can be mined from several types of mineral veins.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.assemble.de: Combine the bullet casing, lead nugget and gunpowder to make bullets.
To maximize the efficiency of bullet production, consider using a deployer, as they consume fewer resources.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.casings.sub: Press brass in a press with the bullet mold.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.lead_nugget: Obtain lead nuggets from lead bars.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.molds.title: Bullet Molds
quest.tech.bullet_automation.molds.subti: Find and loot a bullet mold.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.molds.descr: Obtain any bullet mold from factories in the wasteland.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.brass.subti: Combine zinc and copper to create brass.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.brass.descr: You can smelt the brass ingot using any of the following methods; it doesn't matter which one you choose.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.auricupride: Find and harvest auricupride for copper.
Find and harvest sphalerite for zinc.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.galena.desc: Find and harvest galena for lead.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.mineral_sur: Utilize the mineral survey tool to search for traces of mineral veins in the vicinity.
quest.tech.bullet_automation.excavator.d: Once you've located a suitable ore deposit, construct an excavator at that location.
Be warned, a massive amount of energy is required to run it!
quest.tech.bullet_automation.veins.title: Mineral Veins
quest.tech.bullet_automation.veins.descr: Information about all available mineral veins are listed in the Engineer's Manual. Refer to [Overview and Resources > Mineral Deposits] for detailed guidance.
quest.tech.nuclear.guidebook.title: Fundamentals of Nuclear Physics
quest.tech.nuclear.guidebook.subtitle: Reinventing the Future
quest.tech.nuclear.guidebook.description: Even destroyed, the nuclear power plant in the wasteland provides a significant amount of reactor components... Perhaps it is time to try building your own?
The nuclear reactor and its turbines are the end-game power solution for Deceasedcraft. Its immense power output is one of the few things needed to restart the ruined laboratory portal.
However, acquiring the parts needed to assemble such a reactor is quite the challenge, and will likely require significant automation or exploration.
This guidebook will only go through the required parts a reactor will need - consider looking for guides online on how a reactor should be built!
quest.tech.nuclear.guidebook.uranium.des: Uranium is used as the fuel for the reactor, as well as a component for making the reactor fuel rod.
quest.tech.nuclear.guidebook.aluminium.d: Aluminium plates are used to create machine casings, which are used to create the reactor casing, the primary block of the reactor.
quest.tech.nuclear.guidebook.duroplast.d: Duroplast plates are used to create machine casings, which are used to create the reactor casing, the primary block of the reactor.
quest.tech.nuclear.guidebook.steel_plate: Steel plates and rods are used to create many reactor and turbine components.
It is highly recommended to automate your steel production if you are planning to build the larger reactors.
Lead plates are used for reactor casings and control rods.
Like steel, It is highly recommended to automate your lead production if you are planning to build the larger reactors.
quest.tech.nuclear.guidebook.graphite_el: Graphite electrodes are used for reactor control rods.
As they are also used in the Arc Furnace from Immersive Engineering, consider upgrading your smelting setup to take advantage of the increased ore yield.
quest.tech.nuclear.machine_casing.descri: Machine Casings are used to craft the reactor casing.
As they are also used for many Refined Storage components, consider automating this component!
quest.tech.nuclear.reactor_fuel_rod.desc: A reactor needs at least one fuel rod, made of fuel rod blocks stretching from the floor to the ceiling.
The smallest reactor is a 3x3 cube, and has one fuel rod block in the center.
quest.tech.nuclear.reactor_casing.descri: A reactor's walls must be made of reactor casings.

The smallest reactor is a 3x3 cube, which consists of 21 casings, with spaces on the side for the reactor power tap, reactor controller and solid access port, and a space on the top for the reactor control rod.
quest.tech.nuclear.reactor_control_rod.d: Every fuel rod in the reactor must be capped on top with a control rod.
The smallest reactor is a 3x3 cube, and has one control rod block in the middle on top.
quest.tech.nuclear.reactor_solid_access_: The solid access port is the means by which uranium is inserted and waste is extracted from the reactor.
All reactors require a solid access port on one of its sides.
quest.tech.nuclear.reactor_controller.de: The reactor controller is the main control panel for the reactor.
All reactors require a reactor controller.
quest.tech.nuclear.reactor_active_power_: The active power tap is one of two ways to extract power from the reactor. It is best used with Immersive Engineering power cables.
Consider switching to the using other power tap if you cannot extract power from the reactor.
quest.tech.nuclear.reactor_passive_power: The passive power tap is one of two ways to extract power from the reactor. It is best used with pipez cables.
Consider switching to the using other power tap if you cannot extract power from the reactor.
quest.tech.nuclear.turbine.title: Advanced Nuclear Physics
quest.tech.nuclear.turbine.subtitle: But what if we wanted MORE power,,,?
quest.tech.nuclear.turbine.description_1: To extract the maximum possible power from a nuclear reactor requires the construction of steam turbines.
quest.tech.nuclear.turbine.description_2: However, due to their complexity, this guide will not go into detail about how to construct them.
quest.tech.nuclear.turbine.description_3: It is recommended to look at guides or videos online on how turbines should be set up for optimum power production.
quest.tech.cannons.saw.title: Step 0: Moulding
quest.tech.cannons.saw.subtitle: Let's go Gambling!
quest.tech.cannons.saw.description_1: In order to begin making cannons or autocannons, you must first acquire the needed molds by sawing logs with a mechanical saw.
quest.tech.cannons.saw.description_2: You can choose which mould to craft by crafting a List Filter and dragging the desired mould from JEI into the filter list... or you can gamble until you get the mould you want, then set the filter on the saw.
quest.tech.cannons.ac_breech.description: Every autocannon needs a breech at the back.
quest.tech.cannons.ac_recoil.description: Every autocannon needs a recoil spring in the middle, in front of the breech
quest.tech.cannons.ac_barrel.description: One part of three of the autocannon. Every autocannon needs at least one barrel, but can have more depending on how many the material can support.
quest.tech.cannons.cn_loader_end.descrip: The weakest of the loading mechanisms, a cap for the cannon that requires it to be loaded from the front.
Only available for cast iron cannons.
quest.tech.cannons.cn_loader_sliding.des: A medium strength loading mechanism that comes in a quick firing version that can be opened by hand.
Available for all cannons except nethersteel.
quest.tech.cannons.cn_loader_screw.descr: Only available for steel and nethersteel cannons.
quest.tech.cannons.cn_barrel.subtitle: Turns out, girth doesn't matter!
quest.tech.cannons.cn_barrel.description: The smallest cast for a cannon barrel. As barrel thickness does not affect strength, any larger barrel sizes are just for aesthetics.
quest.tech.cannons.cannon_builder.descri: The cannon builder allows for stacking layers of cannon molds together to form a thicker barrel. Be sure to Ponder [W] it for more details.
quest.tech.cannons.casting_sand.title: Step 1: Casting
quest.tech.cannons.casting_sand.subtitle: Avengers, assemble!
quest.tech.cannons.casting_sand.descript: Layers of casting sand need to be stacked and the molds inserted to form the final shape of your cannon, and the desired material pumped into it afterwards.
As the cannon CANNOT be moved or changed by hand after it is cast, the entire cannon must be assembled in one go, with all necessary block molds present.
Be sure to Ponder [W] the sand for more information, or search online for video guides.
quest.tech.cannons.cannon_drill.title: Step 2: Drilling
quest.tech.cannons.cannon_drill.subtitle: Drill go brrr...
quest.tech.cannons.cannon_drill.descript: The next step is boring a hole in the cannon. This requires mounting the cannon on a turntable, providing the drill with torque and water, as well as piston extension poles.
As with casting, be sure to Ponder [W] the drill for more information, or search online for video guides.
quest.tech.cannons.assembly.title: Step 2.5: Moving Parts
quest.tech.cannons.assembly.subtitle: It fell out...
quest.tech.cannons.assembly.description_: Some blocks like the sliding breech, screw breech, autocannon breech or autocannon recoil spring will require additional components to complete after being drilled.
quest.tech.cannons.fan.title: Step 3: Annealing
quest.tech.cannons.fan.subtitle: A fancy word for just cook it again.
quest.tech.cannons.fan.description_1: Cannon layers must be cooked into barrels by blowing lava over them with an encased fan. You can tell if the setup is correct if they start to smoke.
quest.tech.cannons.fan.description_2: Once this is complete, they will transform from layers to barrels or chambers automatically.
quest.tech.cannons.movement.title: Step 1.5: Moving Your Cannon
quest.tech.cannons.movement.subtitle: Time to test your Create knowledge...
quest.tech.cannons.movement.description_: Once casted, cannons cannot be moved by hand or broken. They must be moved around using Create's contraptions and mechanisms.
quest.tech.cannons.cannon_mount.title: Step 4: Mounting
quest.tech.cannons.cannon_mount.subtitle: Create(d) Big Cannons
quest.tech.cannons.cannon_mount.descript: Move the finished cannon onto a cannon mount. Once attached and activated with a lever, the cannon can be steered up and down using the shaft on the side and steered left and right using the shaft on the bottom.
Be sure to Ponder [W] the cannon mount for more information, or search online for video guides.
quest.tech.cannons.artillery.title: Heavy Artillery
quest.tech.cannons.artillery.subtitle: Calling down the Thunder
quest.tech.cannons.artillery.description: In order to fire your cannon, you will need to load shells into it. This guide will only go through the basics of making shells - it is recommended you check guides online for more effective ways to assemble cannons in general.
quest.tech.cannons.autocannon.title: Lead Rain
quest.tech.cannons.autocannon.subtitle: Gun go BRRRRT
quest.tech.cannons.autocannon.descriptio: In order to fire your autocannon, you will need to craft ammo containers, which will need to be loaded with shells. This guide will only go through the basics of making shells - it is recommended you check guides online for more effective ways to assemble cannons in general.
quest.tech.cannons.pump.description_1: Water needs to be pumped into the cannon drill while it is drilling.
quest.tech.cannons.lava.description_1: The encased fan needs to blow into lava to cook the cannon barrels.
quest.tech.cannons.cartridge.complete.de: Combine filled cartridges with a round of your choice.
quest.tech.cannons.ramhead.title: Loading and Removing Shells
quest.tech.cannons.ramhead.description_1: Shells and charges can be loaded by a ram and removed with a worm.
quest.tech.cannons.rod.title: Manual Loading
quest.tech.cannons.rod.description_1: Shells up to three blocks long can be manually loaded using the ram rod.
quest.tech.cannons.rod.description_2: Be sure to Ponder [W] the ram rod for more information!
quest.tech.cannons.loader.title: Automatic Loading
quest.tech.cannons.loader.description_1: A cannon loader is needed for shells longer than three blocks.
quest.tech.cannons.loader.description_2: Be sure to Ponder [W] the cannon loader for more information!
quest.tech.cannons.shells.description_1: There are many other types of cannon rounds - be sure to experiment to find out what works for you!
quest.tech.cannons.charges.description_1: At least one charge needs to be loaded behind a shell for the cannon to fire. The maximum depends on the strength of your cannon - too strong and it might explode, too weak and it might get stuck!
quest.tech.cannons.charges.description_2: You can check how many charges your cannon can withstand by looking at a cannon mount with an assembled cannon using engineer goggles.
quest.tech.radar.bearing.subtitle: Automated Aiming
quest.tech.radar.bearing.description_1: A radar allows you to automatically target and aim cannons at hostile targets.
quest.tech.radar.bearing.description_2: The radar itself must be built on top of a radar bearing and powered.
quest.tech.radar.reciever.description_1: Each radar must have one receiver. Place it on top of the bearing.
quest.tech.radar.dish.description_1: The radar's range can be extended using either radar plates or dishes attached to the receiver.
quest.tech.radar.dish.description_2: Both provide the same benefits and can be used interchangeably.
quest.tech.radar.datalink.subtitle: Sending Coordinates
quest.tech.radar.datalink.description_1: The data link allows for transfer of data from the radar to a monitor, and then to the pitch and yaw controllers. You will need to craft at least three.
quest.tech.radar.monitor.subtitle: I see everything...
quest.tech.radar.monitor.description_1: The monitor allows you to display all mobs within the radar's radius. You can extend it by connecting more monitors, so long as it is a square. (2x2,3x3, etc)
quest.tech.radar.monitor.description_2: Right click on the monitor with a data link, then shift right click on the radar bearing to bind the radar to the monitor.
quest.tech.radar.yawcontroller.descripti: The yaw controller automatically controls the yaw of a cannon. It should be placed on the bottom of the cannon mount and provided with torque.
Right click on a monitor with a data link, then shift right click on the yaw controller to bind the monitor to the controller.
quest.tech.radar.pitchcontroller.descrip: The pitch controller automatically controls the pitch of a cannon. It should be placed on the side of the cannon mount and provided with torque.
Right click on a monitor with a data link, then shift right click on the pitch controller to bind the monitor to the controller.
quest.transport.train.steam_engine.subti: Obtained by looting or sequenced assembly.
quest.transport.train.heat_engine.subtit: Obtained by looting or sequenced assembly.
quest.transport.train.precision_mechanis: Obtained by looting or sequenced assembly.
quest.transport.train.train_casing.descr: The train casing is used in many train-related blocks. Craft one by using a sturdy sheet on a brass casing.
quest.transport.train.train_control.desc: The train controller allows you to actually control your train. Place a seat, sit in it and right click the controller to start driving.
quest.transport.train.train_station.subt: For all your train scheduling needs
quest.transport.train.train_station.desc: The train station allows you to assemble your train, among other things. Ponder it with [W] to get a more detailed tutorial!
quest.transport.train.train_tracks.subti: Obtained by looting or sequenced assembly.
quest.transport.train.train_tracks.descr: Alternatively, try to restore the existing railway system for fast travel!
quest.transport.train.train_assembly.des: Successfully assemble a train using the train station.
quest.transport.train.train_fuel.title: Train Fueling
quest.transport.train.train_fuel.subtitl: Steam power comes in the next patch
quest.transport.train.train_fuel.descrip: Trains require fuels such as coal placed in chests or barrels on them to be able to move.
quest.transport.car.subtitle: Reinventing the wheel.
quest.transport.car.engine.title: Engine
quest.transport.car.engine.subtitle: Not quite a V12... but it'll do.
quest.transport.car.engine.desc_1: The engine required is different depending on the vehicle you plan to make, so check the crafting recipe!
quest.transport.car.engine.desc_2: The engine also determines the speed and acceleration of the vehicle - different vehicles will have different performances.
quest.transport.car.crafter.title: Your First Car
quest.transport.car.crafter.subtitle: What do you mean I can't craft them by hand?
quest.transport.car.crafter.desc_1: Most vehicle parts must be crafted using Create's sequenced assembly, as well as mechanical crafters. It is recommended that you familiarize yourself with how they work!
quest.transport.car.crafter.desc_2: Alternatively, vehicles can spawn in various states of disrepair in the cities, waiting to be restored.
quest.transport.car.car.title: Cars and Bikes
quest.transport.car.car.subtitle: Unfortunately, drifting has been removed due to excessive fatalities.
quest.transport.car.car.desc_1: A wide variety of vehicles can be made, ranging from sports cars to trucks to motorcycles.
quest.transport.car.car.desc_2: They all perform differently, and have different fuel tank sizes and speeds, so experiment to find out what works best for your playstyle.
quest.transport.car.car.desc_3: All vehicles come with built-in storage space, accessible through the vehicle's inventory or by shift-clicking.
quest.transport.car.repair.title: Vehicle Repair
quest.transport.car.repair.desc_1:
Vehicles can be repaired by placing iron or steel ingots into the ingot slot in the car's inventory. Multiple ingots will be required!
Steel is more efficient, but is harder to acquire.
quest.transport.car.repair.desc_2: Watch your vehicle health carefully, vehicles will explode if they reach 0 health with fuel inside!
quest.transport.car.recharge.title: Vehicle Recharging
quest.transport.car.recharge.desc_1: Vehicles can be recharged by placing charged batteries into the battery slot in the car's inventory.
quest.transport.car.recharge.desc_2: The vehicle's battery will also slowly recharge as long as the engine is running.
quest.transport.car.fuels.title: Car Refueling
quest.transport.car.fuels.subtitle: Mmm‚Ä¶ the smell of gasoline.
quest.transport.car.fuels.desc_1: All vehicles support being refueled with biodiesel, diesel, or gasoline.
quest.transport.car.fuels.desc_2: Gasoline is the most efficient fuel for vehicles, followed by diesel, and then biodiesel.
quest.transport.car.canisters.title: Gas Canisters
quest.transport.car.canisters.desc_1: Vehicles can be refueled by placing canisters full of the appropriate fuel type into the fuel slot in the car's inventory.
quest.transport.car.canisters.desc_2: Keep in mind buckets of fuel do not work - Only canisters full of fuel will be accepted.
quest.transport.car.gasstation.title: Gas Stations
quest.transport.car.gasstation.desc_1: The gas station block allows for refueling cars without having to use canisters. To use it, park a vehicle nearby, select it in the gas station's menu, and click the square button.
quest.transport.car.gasstation.desc_2: The gas station can be refueled using canisters, or by pumping gas using pipes into the sides of the block. Only the sides will accept pipes!
quest.transport.car.bodies.title: Body
quest.transport.car.bodies.subtitle: Keeping it all together.
quest.transport.car.bodies.desc_1: Vehicle frames primarily use steel, aluminum and duroplast.
quest.transport.car.wheels.title: Wheels
quest.transport.car.wheels.subtitle: The wheels on the bus go round and round...
quest.transport.car.wheels.desc_1: Wheels are made using aluminium and rubber.
quest.transport.car.wheels.desc_2: There are two kinds of wheels, so be sure to check which kind your car uses!
quest.transport.planes.engine.title: Aircraft Engine
quest.transport.planes.engine.subtitle: Take to the sky!
quest.transport.planes.engine.desc_1: This modpack contains two different plane mods, ¬ß6Immersive Aircraft¬ßr and ¬ß6Simple Planes¬ßr.
quest.transport.planes.engine.desc_2: However, both mods use a common engine block to power their aircraft.
quest.transport.planes.engine.desc_3: Feel free to check the entries for the respective aircraft to have a better understanding of which one is more suitable for you!
quest.transport.planes.sp_upgrades.title: Simple Planes Upgrades
quest.transport.planes.sp_upgrades.desc_: The upgrades for ¬ß6Simple Planes¬ßr can be installed by right-clicking them onto a completed aircraft.
Right-clicking on the aircraft with a wrench will bring up the upgrade window, which allows you to remove upgrades.
Each aircraft can hold up to ¬ßb6¬ßr upgrades (including the engine!).
quest.transport.planes.shooter_upgrade.d: Allows the plane to shoot. Uses arrows.
Fire the weapon with ¬ß6[Left-Click]¬ßr when seated in the plane.
quest.transport.planes.seat_upgrade.desc: Increases the number of players that can sit in your aircraft.
quest.transport.planes.rocket_booster.de: Increases the aircraft's maximum throttle speed.
quest.transport.planes.solar_panel.title: Solar Panel Upgrade
quest.transport.planes.solar_panel.desc_: Allows the aircraft to charge passively when there's sunlight, if the aircraft has an electric engine.
quest.transport.planes.shulker_shell.des: Automatically returns the aircraft to your inventory when you exit it.
quest.transport.planes.armor.title: Plane Armor Upgrade
quest.transport.planes.armor.desc_2: ...Did you know you can use Protection Upgrade Parts on your plane?
quest.transport.planes.floaty.title: Floaty Bedding Upgrade
quest.transport.planes.floaty.desc_1: Allows your plane to float on the water surface.
quest.transport.planes.supplycrate.title: Supply Crate
quest.transport.planes.supplycrate.desc_: Allows your plane to have an inventory, accessible using ¬ß6[I]¬ßr while seated.
Also allows your plane to drop an airdrop using ¬ß6[C]¬ßr.
quest.transport.planes.liquid_engine.des: Runs off liquid fuels like biodiesel or even lava, accessible using ¬ß6[I]¬ßr while seated.
The liquid engine is a mandatory upgrade that must be installed into the aircraft with ¬ß6[Right-Click]¬ßr.
quest.transport.planes.electric_engine.d: Allows the plane to be charged with FE. Needs a charging pad to function.
The electric engine is a ¬ßcmandatory¬ßr upgrade that must be installed into the aircraft with ¬ß6[Right-Click]¬ßr.
quest.transport.planes.furnace_engine.de: Runs off solid fuel such as coal, coal coke, or wood, accessible using ¬ß6[I]¬ßr while seated.
The furnace engine is a ¬ßcmandatory¬ßr upgrade that must be installed into the aircraft with ¬ß6[Right-Click]¬ßr.
quest.transport.planes.workbench.title: Plane Workbench
quest.transport.planes.workbench.desc_1:
The plane workbench is used to craft Simple Planes aircraft. It requires propellers and wood planks. 
The wood planks you choose determines the style of your aircraft.
quest.transport.planes.workbench.desc_2: For a list of how many propellers and how much wood is required, feel free to check the entries for the respective aircraft.
quest.transport.planes.propeller.title: Propeller
quest.transport.planes.propeller.desc_1: Propellers are required for all Simple Planes aircraft. They can be made using mechanical crafters.
quest.transport.planes.simpleaircraft.pl:
The most basic plane.
Seats ¬ßb1¬ßr (¬ßb3¬ßr with upgrade)
¬ßcCannot hold¬ßr any Supply Crates!

Materials Required:
1x Propeller
5x Wood Planks
quest.transport.planes.simpleaircraft.la:
As the name suggests, a large plane.
Seats ¬ßb2¬ßr (¬ßb4¬ßr with upgrade)
Can hold ¬ßbone¬ßr Supply Crate, at the cost of a seat.

Materials Required:
1x Propeller
10x Wood Planks
quest.transport.planes.simpleaircraft.he:
A plane that goes up.
Seats ¬ßb2¬ßr (¬ßb4¬ßr with upgrade)
Can hold ¬ßbone¬ßr Supply Crate, at the cost of a seat.

Materials Required:
2x Propeller
7x Wood Planks
quest.transport.planes.simpleaircraft.ca:
A massive cargo plane.
Seats ¬ßb2¬ßr (¬ßb5¬ßr with upgrade)
Can hold up to ¬ßb8¬ßr Supply Crates.

Materials Required:
4x Propeller
64x Wood Planks
quest.transport.planes.ia_upgrades.title: Immersive Aircraft Upgrades
quest.transport.planes.ia_upgrades.desc_: Immersive Aircraft upgrades are split into two categories, Aircraft Weapons and Aircraft Upgrades.
Check the aircraft quests for a list of slots for each aircraft!
Upgrades can be installed by sitting in the aircraft and pressing ¬ß6[E]¬ßr.
quest.transport.planes.eco_engine.title: Eco Engine
quest.transport.planes.eco_engine.desc_1: The Eco Engine is an optional aircraft upgrade that changes the performance of your aircraft's engine.
quest.transport.planes.eco_engine.desc_2: ¬ßbNOTE:¬ßr Like all Immersive Aircraft upgrade, it takes up an upgrade slot!
quest.transport.planes.nether_engine.des: The Nether Engine is an optional aircraft upgrade that changes the performance of your aircraft's engine.
¬ßbNOTE:¬ßr Like all Immersive Aircraft upgrade, it takes up an upgrade slot!

lore.deceasedcraft.redstone_division.not:
Redstone Division Messaging System
File 1 - Clearance : Black

Orbital Group
Redstone Division
Clearance: Black
Executive Level Only

It seems we‚Äôve been fortunate, gentlemen. We have been allowed the chance to study the [REDACTED] at Site-51. As you all are aware, this is a once-in a lifetime chance to obtain and exploit technologies previously thought impossible.
It comes without saying that whatever we find MUST NOT be traced back to this site.

Redstone Division Messaging System
File 2 - Clearance : Green

Orbital Group
Redstone Division
Clearance: Green
Public Announcement
The Orbital Group would like to extend its thanks to all the researchers at the Redstone Facility for the successful launch of the Refined Storage Solution.
This breakthrough in matter-to-energy conversion would not have been possible without the hard work of all present, and is set to revolutionize the storage and transportation industry forever.

Redstone Division Messaging System
File 3 - Clearance : Red

Orbital Group
Redstone Division
Clearance: Red
Personal Log

Well, now that RF's been launched, hopefully I can stop staring at top secret government artifacts for a while.
We‚Äôve managed to crack over 90% of its secrets, but how the [REDACTED]‚Äôs own computer manages to be self powered eludes us still.
I suspect we will have to dismantle it to find out, but I doubt they‚Äôll ever let us do that.

Redstone Division Messaging System
File 4 - Clearance : Red

Orbital Group
Redstone Division
Clearance: Red
Personal Log

I don‚Äôt know how they‚Äôve done it. Some government‚Äôs backing, perhaps. Managed to snatch that new alien structure right from under all our noses. 
It doesn‚Äôt take a genius to realize that the structure they‚Äôve found isn‚Äôt anything we could make.
Something related to the [REDACTED], perhaps? One can only imagine the possibilities.

Redstone Division Messaging System
File 5 - Clearance : Red

Orbital Group
Redstone Division
Clearance: Red
Personal Log

A portal. The the alien structure they got is a portal. Well, if anything, it might explain how the [REDACTED] got here. ContinuumTech is holding their secrets very tightly, but a discovery of this scale can‚Äôt be swept under the rug for long.
It's far too late to get a foot in the door now, though. The best we can do is join the scramble of other companies trying to get a research agreement with them.

Redstone Division Messaging System
File 6 - Clearance : Black

Orbital Group
Redstone Division
Clearance: Black
Executive Level Only

Gentlemen. As outlined in the brief, we have managed to secure a joint research agreement with ContinuumTech on the alien structures. I would like you to provide a list of suitable staff to be transferred over to the new project.

While they insist on maintaining total control of the portal sites, our teams will be allowed on site to analyze and gather samples of the portal's composition. The goal is to study the portal‚Äôs materials, reverse-engineer it and construct our own.
Going forward, we will be following ContinuumTech's terminology and filing this as Project Orion.

Redstone Division Messaging System
File 7 - Clearance : Red

Orbital Group
Redstone Division
Clearance: Red
Personal Log

I think we‚Äôve about reached the limits of what we can achieve with Project Orion. All our tests indicate the material of the portal isn‚Äôt of this world, and this material unfortunately is exactly what we need to actually open it.
There is no known process that can manufacture this material. We will have to concede to ContinuumTech and work with them to activate an existing one.

Redstone Division Messaging System
File 8 - Clearance : Green

Orbital Group
Redstone Division
Clearance: Green
Public Announcement
The Orbital Group is proud to announce its collaboration with ContinuumTech on Project Nexus, which will be aiming to reactivate the alien portals.
As part of this collaboration, several departments will be transferred to ContinuumTech facilities over the next few months. Selected departments and personnel will be notified shortly.

Redstone Division Messaging System
File 9 - Clearance : Blue

Orbital Group
Redstone Division
Clearance: Blue
Department Members Only

I‚Äôm sure you all have heard the news by now; we‚Äôll be moving this department‚Äôs operations to ContinuumTech‚Äôs facilities as part of Project Nexus. The intent is to collaborate with and assist their efforts to jumpstart the portal.
I‚Äôll be joining them as well as their new Research Director; for those of you choosing to stay behind, it‚Äôs been a pleasure working with you.

Redstone Division Messaging System
File 10 - Clearance : Red

Orbital Group
Redstone Division
Clearance: Red
Personal Log
I‚Äôm not sure if I like the new post. ContinuumTech is far more‚Ä¶ hands on than the Redstone Division ever was. Far more eager to take risks, too.
Understandably, it‚Äôs led them to overtake us in portal research, and now funding, but I feel they‚Äôre playing with fire.
I don‚Äôt know where this will go. I can only do my best. This will be my last log on payroll for the Redstone Division; I‚Äôll see you on the other side.
Message to the Board of Directors

The preliminary results of the unidentified structure in Survey 27 are astounding. It is a discovery that will no doubt change the scientific landscape moving forward. An opportunity of a lifetime we CANNOT afford to miss.

The governments of [REDACTED] and [REDACTED] have agreed to provide sufficient leverage in the ongoing bidding war for the site. Recommend ALL available funds be redirected towards this goal IMMEDIATELY.

Signed, C.
ContinuumTech General Announcement - 1

ContinuumTech
Tomorrow's Future, Today

As you are aware, starting later this month the Orbital Group‚Äôs Redstone Division will be collaborating with us with Project Nexus. Their work will focus on material study of the alien structure, and will henceforth be known as Project Orion.
Please do help our colleagues settle in as they adjust to our internal systems, and be aware that there may be some disruption of services as we update our systems to handle the increased data load.
ContinuumTech thanks you for your contributions.
ContinuumTech General Announcement - 2

ContinuumTech
Tomorrow's Future, Today
As you may have heard, ContinuumTech is moving to secure the other alien structures discovered recently, and are in talks with the relevant nations to establish further laboratories to study them.

The research and samples from these new sites is expected to accelerate our work on Project Orion and Project Nexus. 
Staff who have indicated an interest in transferring to these other sites will have received a memo on their application status.
ContinuumTech thanks you for your contributions.
ContinuumTech General Announcement - 3

ContinuumTech
Tomorrow's Future, Today

It is with a heavy heart that we must announce the sunsetting of Project Orion. While we have made many breakthroughs with material research on the alien structures, it is clear we have reached the limits of what

can be achieved with what we currently have. All affected Redstone Division personnel will have received a memo detailing their new positions within the ongoing Project Nexus, details on relocation to other ContinuumTech
divisions, or return to the Redstone Division. Please reach out to HR if any issues arise regarding relocation.
ContinuumTech thanks you for your contributions.
Personal Log 1
Research Director, Project Nexus

Quite an undertaking for my first assignment as the new Research Director. I‚Äôve caught up on where Project Nexus has gone since my work on Project Orion, but truth be told, it doesn‚Äôt look that good on this end either.

While the team has gotten the structure to react somewhat to an input of energy, all signs seem to imply properly activating it would require a calibrated pulse far greater than what our on-site power plant can provide.
At the very least, a significant investment in the site‚Äôs infrastructure will be required. I can only hope this will take a few years, and not a few decades‚Ä¶
ContinuumTech General Announcement - 4

ContinuumTech
Tomorrow's Future, Today

ContinuumTech would like to congratulate all staff of Project Nexus for a successful portal activation. We understand that this has been a several year journey for many of you on site, but we must remind you that this information is still

strictly classified and must not be disclosed to the public until we can confirm the safety of the facility and the structure. Any inquiries on the matter and the future direction of the Project will be answered in the upcoming General Meeting.
ContinuumTech thanks you for your contributions.
Personal Log 2
Research Director, Project Nexus

Well, it took three years, a whole new facility and power plant, but it‚Äôs done. We sent a drone through the portal the other day. Everything looks good, the atmosphere looks breathable, and there are no signs of life.
From what we can tell, it looks like there‚Äôs an extensive cave system on the other side, like the one where we originally found the portal all those years back.
We haven‚Äôt gotten the full mineral analysis back yet, but the results look promising, especially if the mineral abundance in that cave is as rich as the scans say they are.
Amazingly, the portal seems to stay open with almost no energy input afterwards, too. Guess that power plant was a bit of a waste. Only a matter of time till we send someone through, at this rate.
Personal Log 3
Research Director, Project Nexus

We‚Äôve taken to calling the new material the exploration teams have found in the Abyss ‚ÄúAncient Debris‚Äù. It seems to be crucial to the operation of the portal structures, but its applications outside that are nothing short of miraculous.
Its extreme density and light weight after processing make it an ideal candidate for aerospace and military applications, and that‚Äôs really just scratching the surface.
As expected, our benefactors have already expressed interest in acquiring the material for themselves, though it remains to be seen if harvesting Ancient Debris on a large scale is possible at all.
It is without a doubt a world-changing discovery‚Ä¶ I only hope we don‚Äôt regret the choice of coming here to find it in the first place.
ContinuumTech General Announcement - 5

ContinuumTech
Tomorrow's Future, Today
ContinuumTech would like to announce the official completion and activation of sub-portals in Abyss Sectors 1 to 4.
Personnel transiting through the main laboratory portals are advised to check their travel itinerary, as they may have been rescheduled for transit through the sub-portals instead.

All Abyss contractors and staff are advised to maintain proper clearance in the transit zones, as heavy machinery and an increase of traffic is expected as we continue establishment and colonization of Sites 2 through 6.
lore.deceasedcraft.continuumtech.note_10:
Personal Log 4
Research Director, Project Nexus

I can't shake this feeling that things are going to go badly. For all of us. They might have started building that massive military complex to handle whatever those‚Ä¶ things in the Abyss are, but I have a feeling it‚Äôs all just hot air.
For one, it‚Äôs woefully underfunded for what it is. Many nations are insistent that they use their own military to handle matters on a case-by-case basis.
At the same time, our exploration teams are still going out essentially without any form of security whatsoever.
I‚Äôve raised my concerns, but frankly, it‚Äôs not my department to manage. I can only hope things get better before they get far, far worse‚Ä¶
lore.deceasedcraft.continuumtech.note_11:
ContinuumTech General Announcement - 6

ContinuumTech
Tomorrow's Future, Today
ContinuumTech would like to announce the official completion of the C-X Military Complex, the international hub for all Abyss monitoring and military control!
With our international partners and assistance from over 100 member countries, we at ContinuumTech aim to keep the safety of our exploration and extraction teams our top priority.

Staff scheduled to transfer to the Military Complex will have received a memo detailing your allotted moving time as well as location within the facility. For further enquiries, please check with the Security Department.
ContinuumTech thanks you for your contributions.
lore.deceasedcraft.continuumtech.note_12:
ContinuumTech General Announcement - 7

ContinuumTech
Tomorrow's Future, Today

Due to increased hostile lifeforms near Abyss Sectors 60 to 72, all research and extraction personnel are to travel accompanied by specialist military escort. Please check with the Security Department for your assigned team and escort details.
lore.deceasedcraft.continuumtech.note_13:
Personal Log 5
Research Director, Project Nexus
I‚Äôve been complaining to Security for almost a year now, with little to no results. They might have built that giant military facility, but given the speed and scope of the expansion I fear
they‚Äôre still woefully underestimating the threat of the new dimension. We haven‚Äôt even finished our surveys, and they‚Äôre already setting up what, twelve Sites? With a few thousand people each?
Not to mention the little ‚Äúincidents‚Äù the exploration and military teams keep having with the local wildlife‚Ä¶Some of them have reported feeling unwell in the recent days.
I‚Äôve requested that my team be moved to assist with researching this new sickness, though if I‚Äôm being honest, it‚Äôs mostly to keep me and my staff firmly on this side of the portal.
lore.deceasedcraft.continuumtech.note_14:
Emergency Address - High Priority

ContinuumTech
Tomorrow's Future, Today

This is an automated message. A security breach has been detected at Gate 21, Site 40.
Military personnel have been informed and are en-route.

All personnel are to evacuate the premises immediately. Please leave your assigned tasks and do not bring along any personal belongings. Non-ContinuumTech personnel are advised to follow the orders of local security forces.
This is not a test. This is not a test.
lore.deceasedcraft.continuumtech.note_15:
Personal Log 6
Research Director, Project Nexus

I warned them. I warned them their precautions weren‚Äôt enough. If the military hadn‚Äôt managed to claw their way back to the portal, they‚Äôd have to have dropped a warhead on the entire city. 
How many died? A thousand? Two thousand?

I‚Ä¶ cannot with a clear conscience keep working for a corporation and governments this reckless. I just can‚Äôt. I‚Äôve already tendered my resignation; it seems thankfully enough of my old team from the Redstone Division agreed.
I hope what I‚Äôve done on what we've taken to calling Lung Bloom is sufficient for my successor to pick up the pieces. I‚Äôll continue it regardless wherever I find myself. Signing off.

lore.deceasedcraft.earthcomplex.kane_log:
Personal Log - Abyss
Research Director, Project Horizon - Dr.Kane

Planet Report:
Habitable Level: A
Resource Level: S
Hostility Level: N/A
Codename: Abyss
We've managed to enter the first unknown planet interior and discovered it is full of rich minerals, including unobtanium from earths.

There is sign of oxygen here, but wasn't as plentiful as from the earth itself, it is possible to have sign of life discovered further away, within the initial 50km of discovering, there isn't any sign of life at the moment.
This place is beyond one could imagine its possibility, where as well the resource needed for constructing the portal is also found here.
We'll also send a report to suggest setting out an outpost or possibly settlement here for all the mining operations.

Most importantly, the material needed to construct the portal is found here, it is identical to the one we found on earth, in order to construct or further the research on portal, we'll need to revive Project Orion.

Personal Log - Nether
Research Director, Project Horizon - Dr.Kane

Planet Report:
Habitable Level: F
Resource Level: B
Hostility Level: S
Codename: Nether

After several years of expansion on the first planet we found, the Abyss, we manage to discover a secondary planet due to the increase funding of the Horizon Team and more portals for trials and errors.

There is also sign of oxygen here, but scarcely, most notably found is that this place is extremely hot, special suit is needed to withstand the heat in this planet. Lava flowing or pool can be seen almost anywhere.

This place is full of hostile objects, it is our first time seeing a living skeleton walking around without any external source of organic tissues to move themselves. There are even more dangerous unit out there.
We do not recommend this place is safe and suitable for further exploration, as hostile objects are getting more and more common the further we delve in.

Personal Log - End
Research Director, Project Horizon - Dr.Kane

Planet Report:
Habitable Level: F
Resource Level: F
Hostility Level: S
Codename: End
Third planet discovered, or is this really a planet? It does not feel like a planet to me... Did we just accidentally tear through the fabric and entered another dimension?

I only see infinite amount of floating island across the horizons, endless yellowish pale rocks, with no end to it, the sky seems to be dark forever, there is no sign of any sunlight or stars, no oxygen as well.

We discovered a species that's hostile upon eye contact, they act aggressively whenever someone looked into their eyes. They seem to have ability to teleport around which injured a few of my team members during the evacuation process.

We do not recommend this place is safe and suitable for further exploration, however the hostile species here seem to have potential for our Symbiosis Department to research and take a look how do they work.
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_1.ti: REDSTONE RESEARCH COMPANY ANNOUNCES: REFINED STORAGE
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_1.co: A press conference was held today at the Orbital Group, celebrating the public release of their innovative new matter-to-energy storage system.
Spearheaded by their Redstone Research Division, this project has been several decades in the making, and has already drastically changed how logistics and storage of bulk items are managed.

‚ÄúWith the help of all our enterprise partners these few decades,‚Äù an Orbital Group spokesperson was quoted as saying, ‚ÄúWe are pleased to announce the Refined Storage Grid, a small, portable version of Refined Storage for the family home.‚Äù
While use of the Refined Storage System has so far been available only to large companies and enterprise users, the Orbital Group intends to release a consumer version slated for later this year.
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_2.ti: STRANGE STRUCTURES DISCOVERED IN NEWLY EXPLORED CAVE
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_2.co: Exploration teams mapping out a local cave system have discovered a strange gate-like structure, deep beneath the ground. ‚ÄúI would hesitate to call it alien,‚Äù one of the discoverers was quoted as saying,

‚Äúbut it certainly needs a very good explanation how it got where it is.‚Äù The discovery has sparked a veritable bidding war, with the winner being ContinuumCorp, a research company founded not too long after the discovery.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs plenty of speculation at the moment,‚Äù a representative from ContinuumCorp replied when asked. ‚ÄúRest assured, we will provide up-to-date reports once we get a clearer picture of the situation.‚Äù
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_3.co: After a secretive decade-long research program, representatives at ContinuumCorp have announced the successful re-lighting of the alien portal discovered deep underground.
Their plans for further exploration beyond the portal have yet to be finalized, but rumors abound that many nations have already signed up to be among the first to stake a claim in the region beyond.

‚ÄúRest assured,‚Äù a representative from ContinuumCorp was quoted as saying, ‚ÄúWe are taking all necessary precautions to ensure the safety of our exploration teams. We will, of course, release up-to-date reports on the status of the exploration as we get more details.‚Äù
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_4.ti: FIERCE BATTLE FOR ABYSS MINING CLAIMS
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_4.co: Recent reports indicate that competition for mining claims in the Abyss is stronger than ever, with record-setting bids of over 300 billion emeralds by wealthy nations just this month.

The past year since the activation has seen many nations and corporations begin large-scale operations in the Abyss, including the founding of the first permanent Abyss settlement. It is yet to be known what effects this rapid expansion will have on the global economy.

This news comes concurrently with an announcement by ContinuumCorp of their new megaproject, a massive military installation in the Abyss, supported by the C-X military installation on this side of the portal.
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_5.co: ContinuumCorp reported record-breaking profits yet again this month, firmly placing it as the wealthiest corporation on the planet. This spike in revenue is attributed to the massive bidding wars for claims in the Abyss, which has led to accusations of favouritism and corruption.
‚ÄúYou just don‚Äôt see growth this fast without some form of inside intervention,‚Äù an analyst was reported as saying. ‚ÄúThere has to be some collusion with governments going on on the inside.‚Äù

Many others also point to large concessions granted by governments towards ContinuumCorp as evidence of foul play, such as the ceding of land around portal areas to the corporation, in exchange for ownership of land in the Abyss.
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_6.co: ContinuumCorp has announced the first successful tests of their prototypes of a man-made portal, according to a press release by the company just this week.
This new leap forward in progress comes after almost a year since the activation of the original Abyss portals, and is expected to bring even greater profits to the already massive megacorporation.
While the corporation has stated that the focus of these new portals will be focused on bringing increased connectivity to the settlements in the Abyss,
many have started speculation on the potential of the technology, including the possibility of using it for planetary colonization, or even interstellar travel.
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_7.co: Leaked by ContinuumCorp insiders, the following photos show what appear to be hostile lifeforms in the new dimension, confirming the speculations of many that life does indeed exist inside the Abyss.

‚ÄúThe world has got to know what‚Äôs on the other side of the portal,‚Äù the staff member, whose identity has been hidden for safety reasons stated, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not a paradise waiting to be mined for resources. It‚Äôs more like hell.‚Äù

The professional community however, remains skeptical. ‚ÄúUntil we have an official announcement, these leaks should be taken with a grain of salt,‚Äù an anonymous researcher was quoted saying, ‚ÄúThey look too much like stereotypical horror film monsters to be real.‚Äù
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_8.ti: HOSTILE CREATURES BREAK CONTAINMENT, THOUSANDS FEARED DEAD
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_8.co: The world reels in horror after one of ContinuumTech‚Äôs labs was breached yesterday, with thousands of hostile lifeforms overrunning the lab‚Äôs portal and spilling into the surrounding city.
With the existing security completely overwhelmed, the swarm was only stopped with external military intervention, at great cost.

ContinuumTech currently faces lawsuits of over 500 billion, though the economic damages to the city and surrounding areas are estimated to be far higher. ContinuumTech has not responded to any inquiries regarding the incident.
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_9.co: The illness first discovered by Abyss researchers four months ago continues to spread through the Abyss towns, with the thousandth recorded case reported just this last week.

Nicknamed ‚ÄúLung Bloom‚Äù or ‚ÄúDust Lung‚Äù by Abyss residents, the fungal-like infection causes common symptoms such as fever and coughing, through which spores are released to potentially infect other hosts.
The symptoms fade over several weeks, though it is yet to be determined whether there will be any long-term effects from the sickness.
ContinuumCorp has stated an intention to implement measures to contain the infection, including quarantining all current Abyss residents as well as limiting travel to and from the Abyss.
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_10.t: OPERATION NIGHTFALL INEFFECTIVE, CONTINUUMCORP SECURITY IN QUESTION
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_10.c: Operation Nightfall was supposed to be a large-scale multi-national effort to clear perimeters of up to 50km around major settlements, but was stalled after logistical failures and difficulties navigating the Abyss‚Äôs cavernous terrain.
In several cases, units were forced to retreat after expending all their ammunition after nearly being overrun.
The failure of ContinuumCorp to reduce the buildup of hostile creatures near the Abyss settlements has brought a new wave of criticism towards the megacorporation,
claiming that their security forces are ineffective against the growing horde of entities now threatening the security of the many Abyss extraction operations.
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_11.c: A mining supervisor in Site 72 was reported missing today after failing to show up at a scheduled status check. He joins the growing list of unexplained disappearances plaguing the Abyss Sites, now numbering in the dozens.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm certain it has something to do with those creatures the military failed to hold off,‚Äù an Abyss resident was quoted as saying, ‚ÄúI mean, if they can‚Äôt even clear them from where they are, who knows how close they‚Äôve gotten to the Site itself?‚Äù

Many Abyss residents, contractors and researchers have begun to raise protests about the safety of their working conditions, joining the growing crowd of unrest towards ContinuumCorp‚Äôs poor management of the situation.
ContinuumCorp has not responded to any inquiries regarding the incident.
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_12.t: EVACUATION ORDER ISSUED FOR ABYSS SITES
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_12.c: A multinational joint task force has officially announced intent to withdraw all civilian Abyss personnel within 6 months, following the attack of Site 72 by a massive swarm of Abyssal creatures.

The task force, known to the community as Abyss Central Command, intends to start by evacuating the outer settlements first, handing control of the Sites over to respective government militaries as they attempt to fight off the hostile incursion.
This announcement comes as the first cases of Lung Bloom, the illness first recorded in the Abyss, are being reported in the labs and residents surrounding the portal.

ContinuumCorp released a statement regarding the situation, stating ‚ÄúGiven the severity of the situation, we have handed over control of all Abyss portals to their respective governments. We will continue to assist any and all governmental efforts in securing the Abyss.‚Äù
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_13.t: ABYSS DECLARED LOST, PORTAL SHUTDOWN DATE DECLARED
lore.deceasedcraft.generalnews.note_13.c: Following the loss of Site 16, the last major military stronghold in the Abyss, a unanimous decision was made by all member nations of the Joint Task Force to withdraw from the Abyss entirely, with all portals scheduled to automatically shut down a month from this date.

The decision comes after a string of crippling defeats, in which the combined forces of the task force were systematically overrun by Abyssal creatures, leading to the loss of almost all of the outer settlements, and the deaths of several thousand civilians.

This choice is not without widespread condemnation, however, as it is estimated that the evacuation of the remaining towns will not be able to be completed before the portals close in a month, leading to the stranding and certain death of many trapped in the Abyss.
lore.deceasedcraft.residential_a.survivo:
Apocalypse Survival Guide - 1
By The Lone Survivor

Hey there. Whoever's reading this, I hope you're doing well.
I'm... not sure why I'm writing this. I'm not even sure if there's anyone left.

But I've been around the block a while now, and if anyone finds this, maybe they can make use of the knowledge I've gained.
At the very least, it'll be some proof I existed.

So, the first district. Lots of houses. Food's and water's generally not an issue; focus on getting yourself established.
You can fill up on water from the sinks; it's safer that way.
Anyways, I'm going to list some of the important buildings on the next few pages.

Polyclinic. Probably your best shot at staving off the infection. Lots of infected there, make sure you've got good weapons, or just run around them.
Only thing that you can't deal with is the infection, so stock up on the cure as soon as you can.

Police station. Some decent guns in there. I sometimes can pick up a broadcast on my radio.
Can't make out who it's from, but it's on a police frequency for sure. Maybe someone's still in one of them. Not the one I checked, though.
Lastly, community center. Not as important, but there's shulker shells here. Good for storage. I hope you've already got a backpack for all this loot.
That's about it. I ran into an old man in one of the houses here too. Couldn't stop for long, but maybe you can pay him a visit.

I'll try my best to keep documenting my journey as I move to the next district.
If you're reading this, then I hope it's been useful for you.
Happy hunting, and best of luck.
lore.deceasedcraft.residential_b.holiday:
My mom's going to take me to the beach this vacation!
I‚Äôm a bit worried about her health, though‚Äîshe seems to have caught the flu after coming home from work...
I really hope she gets better soon, so we can enjoy the beach together again!
lore.deceasedcraft.residential_b.avm.con:
Q: Yo A! Did you see the latest season of Animation vs. Minecraft? Damn, that was insane!

A: I know, right? The fight between the Orange King and Herobrine was so well executed‚ÄîI absolutely loved it!

Q: Alan and his team did such an amazing job. It honestly felt like a full-length movie to me!

A: Totally! I really hope we get to see more of it.
lore.deceasedcraft.residential_c.travel_:
Hey Victoria! Have you finished packing your luggage? We're about to head to the hotel district.
Wait, Dad! Give me a few more minutes‚ÄîI‚Äôm still packing my snacks!

Don‚Äôt forget to bring the cooling coats! It‚Äôs going to be really hot over there, especially where we're staying!
I know, Dad!
lore.deceasedcraft.residential_c.apocaly:
Holy shit... I can't believe it‚Äôs actually happening. The apocalypse‚Äîit's real. It‚Äôs finally started! Years of training, years of waiting... 
This is it. I‚Äôm about to become the protagonist of this damn world!

Hey Aiden! Is the camera rolling? We've got some zombies right over there, come over and film‚Äî
Wait... What are you‚Äî
No! You're infected already?! Dammit! Don‚Äôt bite me!
Shit!

*sniffles* Mom, where are you...? I‚Äôm scared. There's loud noises and screaming outside... You told me to stay inside and not go out, but... It's been a while now...
What happened to Dad? He looked hurt...it was like something bit him... Is he okay...? Where are you guys...? *sniffles*

Wait‚Äîwhat? It‚Äôs been delayed another hour!? I want a refund. A refund right now!

lore.deceasedcraft.ruined_hospital.notic:
Due to excessive reported cases of the Abyss Sickness (colloquially known as "Lung Bloom") in the region, this hospital is now under military quarantine.
For your safety, please follow all instructions given out by military personnel.

If you or a loved one are currently experiencing symptoms like fever, coughing, restlessness, or delirium, please inform attendant staff immediately.
If not, please vacate the premises as soon as possible.
Thank you for your cooperation.

¬ß7¬ßoDr. Randall & Dr. Tyberghein¬ßr

Research Log. Doctor Tyberghein.
Cultivation of the plants from the Nether provided by C-Corp proceeds apace.
Of note, the species known as "Nether Wart" has been growing excellently in captivity.

Preliminary research has shown promising applications as a base for medical serums, but further tests are required before commercial cultivation can begin.
Unfortunately, this trend does not apply to the other species provided.

Both species of fungus and roots provided show few scientific applications, but may find a niche as a curiosity for collectors of exotic plants.
Cultivation of the "Nether Trees" discovered by the project was unsuccessful.

¬ßbProject HORIZON¬ßr
Nether Material Experiments
-------------------
¬ß7¬ßoDr. Randall & Dr. Tyberghein¬ßr

Doc Randall here, creating this log as an update for the materials we got from Project Horizon.
So, we've had to return the skull and sand to the gallery since the last update, but the results we ran from the tests were... astounding, to say the least.

First, the skull. We're not sure what creature it comes from (C-Corp won't tell us), but it seems to cause anything touching it to rapidly decay. 
The effect isn't strong enough to affect anything outside of touch range, thankfully.

Likewise, the sand seems to cause a similar, if weakened effect. 
What is interesting, however, is how the two seem to react if brought together in close proximity, almost as though wanting to merge into something greater.

I'm sure there's something worth exploring here, but since the gate to the Nether has been shut permanently materials like these are in woefully short supply.
If only the gallery would just allow us to run more tests...

lore.deceasedcraft.the_first.worker_1.ti:
The Founder
-------------------
Voice Recording - The First
lore.deceasedcraft.the_first.worker_1.co: Hey Mia, how long have you been working here? I‚Äôve always been curious‚Äîhave you ever seen the founder of ContinuumCorp?
Not really. I've been here for almost five years, but I've never once seen the founder. It‚Äôs always the CEO who shows up.
Interesting. For a company this massive, it‚Äôs almost like the founder‚Äôs a myth.
Yeah, I know what you mean. But hey, the pay‚Äôs good and they put me in charge of this tower, so I‚Äôm not complaining.
Still... it‚Äôs strange how ContinuumCorp rose to become a mega-corporation in just ten years. Maybe the founder really is some kind of genius.

lore.deceasedcraft.the_first.secretary.t:
A Strange Visit
-------------------
Personal Log - The First
lore.deceasedcraft.the_first.secretary.c: I‚Äôm not sure if I should even write this down, but things are getting quite strange around here. The CEO met up with someone again today, completely out of the blue and off his schedule.
When I walked in to check, he just stopped and told me to cancel the rest of the appointments for today. And we had some pretty important ones, too.
And like the last few times, no recordings, no documents -  nothing. It's like it never happened at all. What am I supposed to do with that?
I know the boss does what he wants, but it's supposed to be my job to keep track of these things...I... I think I need a break.
lore.deceasedcraft.the_ring.butcher.cont: I've kidnapped countless people in the changing rooms, slicing them apart piece by piece. I never felt remorse‚Äîinstead, I felt joy. Purpose. The meaning of life.

But today marks the end.
Not because of guilt. I have none.
But because there are no more living humans left.
Only the undead remain‚Äîlifeless husks that shuffle aimlessly, spreading their infection like a plague, creating more of their mindless kind.

There's no spark in them. No fear. No resistance. No satisfaction.
And without living prey, my purpose is gone.

So I shall ascend‚Äîto a better place‚Äî
Where perhaps, I can continue doing what I love.
lore.deceasedcraft.the_ring.penthouse_su:
No‚Ä¶ this can‚Äôt be happening. There has to be someone out there somewhere.
I can‚Äôt die like this‚Äînot now.

I still have a future ahead of me‚Ä¶
I just became successful, just found my way in life...

This can‚Äôt be how it ends.

God damn it‚Ä¶
They promised there'd be rescue!
lore.deceasedcraft.nuclear_reactor.power:
Voice Transcript - Reactor Control
-------------------
Dr. Henrik Larsen
H: Looks like we're holding around 500,000. That's stable enough ‚Äî I think we can call it a day. Next shift should be here to take over any second now.
B: Hey, uh... why do we have so many power stations out here anyways? This region only needs one, maybe two... but there are dozens!
H: Ah ‚Äî no-one's told you yet? ContinuumCorp has an Abyss Gate in this area. Each time they send something through, that's maybe a hundred, two hundred RF. Can you imagine that?
B: And considering how much the news says they've been expanding on the other side... yeah, it ‚Äî it makes sense now.
H: Uh huh. Strange thing is, they say they've been using the existing alien portals for all this. We've not found whatever's powering the portals, so question is ‚Äî how'd the aliens do it?
lore.deceasedcraft.nuclear_reactor.emerg:
Voice Transcript - Reactor Control
-------------------
Dr. Henrik Larsen
H: We've got to let Abyss Control know ‚Äî we can't keep up with this level of power demand. They have to slow down.
B: B-but the evacuation isn't done yet ‚Äî we've got three, four Sites left to pull out ‚Äî

H: I don't know what the hell's going on on the other side, but there's too many things coming through. The reactor's going to boil at this rate ‚Äî and then they'll lose the gate, along with this whole region.
B: What... what do we do?
H: ...Send a priority message to Abyss Control. We can hold for another four hours... maybe. After that... god knows what'll happen.
lore.deceasedcraft.nuclear_reactor.meltd:
Emergency Broadcast - Reactor Control
-------------------
Dr. Henrik Larsen
‚Äî Yes, I know we're getting overrun! We're not the damn military, we can't deal with these creatures!
Look, what's more important is we need to get to the reactor building ‚Äî we need to shut it down, or we and everyone else in this damn district is going to die anyways!
Get the core team members, get whatever gear you can ‚Äî we're going to try and push them back long enough to do what has to be done.
This is Dr. Henrik Larsen to anyone on this frequency ‚Äî I have no idea how you're going to be able to do it, but we MUST buy time to shut the reactor down!
I don't know if the military will make it in time ‚Äî or if there even is a military left, but if this reactor goes it'll take the whole district with it! Millions will die!
I'm going to go with the damage control team to try and cut our way to the core ‚Äî the rest of you, please, hold them off a bit longer!
lore.deceasedcraft.nuclear_reactor.after:
Hello? Anyone on this frequency? Larsen?
Shit ‚Äî I think this district's reactor is gone too. Getting radiation spikes even from here.

Uh... I don't know if anyone's still alive in there, but as soon as we deal with the entities attacking us, we'll try to send help.
We managed to shut down our reactor safely, but a lot of the others didn't ‚Äî you included.
Ach, what am I doing, talking as if there's anyone left to hear this...
